original: gyur pas gcig gis gcig bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: gyur pas gcig gis gcig bskyed pa ste /
translated: because they generate each other.

original: lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not different, because they are connate.

original: 'ching ba gang gis zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal gyis te /
analyzed: 'ching ba gang gis zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal gyis te /
translated: “By which bondage” refers to the latent dispositions.

original: de yod na de las mi 'grol ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yod na de las mi 'grol ba'i phyir te /
translated: If they exist, one is not liberated from them,

original: bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latent dispositions and the entanglements have the same meaning.

original: gang bcings pa zhes bya ba ni sems te /
analyzed: gang bcings pa zhes bya ba ni sems te /
translated: “That which is bound” refers to the mind,

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with the mind and not associated with it.

original: mtshungs bar ldan pa ma yin pa smos pa ni thar pa'i skabs yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshungs bar ldan pa ma yin pa smos pa ni thar pa'i skabs yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The mention of the not associated is in order to show that there is an occasion for liberation.

original: lus kyi 'gro ba dang / khams dang rgyus skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
analyzed: lus kyi 'gro ba dang / khams dang rgyus skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
translated: It shows that the mind is defiled by the defilements of the body, of the realms, and of the causes of birth.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i mtshams sbyor ba'i 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa nyid dang / khams gsum pa rnam par phye ba nyid dang / sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba'i zug rngu dang / nga rgyal dang gti mug gi khan mtho ba chen po nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i mtshams sbyor ba'i 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa nyid dang / khams gsum pa rnam par phye ba nyid dang / sred pa dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba'i zug rngu dang / nga rgyal dang gti mug gi khan mtho ba chen po nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The suffering of suffering is the suffering of the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts.🔽The suffering of change is the suffering of humans and the desire realm gods.🔽The all-pervasive suffering of conditioned existence is the suffering of the form and formless realms.🔽The three kinds of unsatisfactoriness are the unsatisfactoriness of suffering, the unsatisfactoriness of change, and the unsatisfactoriness of conditioned existence.🔽The unsatisfactoriness of suffering is the suffering that is recognized as suffering by ordinary beings.

original: phyogs gsum po dag la thar pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la sogs pa'i las 'khor ba dang mthun par 'byung bar byed pa tshad med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gsum po dag la thar pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la sogs pa'i las 'khor ba dang mthun par 'byung bar byed pa tshad med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The unsatisfactoriness of change is the suffering that is pleasant but changes into suffering, like the pleasure of the gods of the Thirty-three when they are burned by the fire of the battle with the asuras.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par byed pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par byed pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
translated: The unsatisfactoriness of conditioned existence is the suffering that is recognized as suffering by the noble ones, who see it as suffering.🔽The unsatisfactoriness of suffering is the suffering of the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts.🔽The unsatisfactoriness of change is the suffering of humans and the desire realm gods.🔽The unsatisfactoriness of conditioned existence is the suffering of the form and formless realms.🔽The three kinds of pain are the pain of pain, the pain of separation, and the pain of conditioned existence.🔽The pain of pain is the pain that is recognized as pain by ordinary beings.🔽The pain of separation is the pain that is pleasant but changes into pain, like the pleasure of the gods of the Thirty-three when they are burned by the fire of the battle with the asuras.🔽The pain of conditioned existence is the pain that is recognized as pain by the noble ones, who see it as pain.🔽The pain of pain is the pain of the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: gang gi phyir las rnam pa gsum gyi gzhi rgyun mi 'chad pa nas mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa tha dad pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes
analyzed: gang gi phyir las rnam pa gsum gyi gzhi rgyun mi 'chad pa nas mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa tha dad pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes
translated: Because he knows perfectly the continuity of the basis of the three kinds of action, up to the point where he knows perfectly the eighty-four thousand different kinds of afflicted conduct.

original: gsungs pa'o // phyogs gsum ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i phyogs dang / sdom pa med pa'i phyogs dang / mu stegs can gyi phyogs so //🔽las kyi rgyu ba thibs po rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa'o // phyogs gsum ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i phyogs dang / sdom pa med pa'i phyogs dang / mu stegs can gyi phyogs so // las kyi rgyu ba thibs po rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The three aspects are the aspect of enjoyment of sense-objects, the aspect of lack of restraint, and the aspect of heterodox views.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid rab tu dbye bas ston te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid rab tu dbye bas ston te /
translated: The classification of the thickets of the evolution of action is shown by the classification of the causes of the life-cycle.

original: gang gi phyir de las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa nyid dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa nyid dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he knows perfectly the virtuous, non-virtuous, and indeterminate actions.

original: rang bzhin rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The teaching by way of the division of nature is that which is stated as “the nature of informative form and non-informative form.”

original: thabs rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir sems dang lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir sems dang lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The teaching by way of the division of means is that which is stated as “arisen simultaneously with mind and not separate from it.”

original: 'bras bu sogs pa dang mi sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu sogs pa dang mi sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the division of the result that is accumulated and not accumulated is that which is stated as “the cause of the result that is not lost and the connection with the result.”

original: rgyu @234b rang gi ngang gis skad cig tu 'jig cing /🔽'phel ba dang 'bras bu chud mi za zhing mtshams sbyor ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu @234b rang gi ngang gis skad cig tu 'jig cing / 'phel ba dang 'bras bu chud mi za zhing mtshams sbyor ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The cause is momentary disintegration by its very nature.🔽The result is not lost and connects with the cause.

original: 'bras bu ma smin pa dang / smin zin pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma smin pa dang / smin zin pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the division of the result that is not yet ripened and that which is already ripened is that which is stated as “having karmic maturation and not having karmic maturation.”

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o//
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o//
translated: The result that is not yet ripened is having karmic maturation. The result that is already ripened is not having karmic maturation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the division of the discordant class and antidote is that which is stated as “the antidote that abandons and the antidote that is the focal object of non-attachment.”

original: nag po dang / dkar po dang / tha dad pa dang / sna tshogs kyi las phyogs du ma yang dag par len pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //🔽rkyen rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir las kyi zhing tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nag po dang / dkar po dang / tha dad pa dang / sna tshogs kyi las phyogs du ma yang dag par len pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o // rkyen rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir las kyi zhing tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: black, white, various, and manifold actions are taken up.🔽The teaching by way of the classification of conditions is that it is said, “The field of action is immeasurable.”🔽The teaching by way of the classification of non-fixed and fixed is that it is said, “The fixed and the unfixed are distinguished.”🔽The teaching by way of the classification of definite and indefinite is that it is said, “The definite and the indefinite are distinguished.”

original: khor zug ma yin pa dang / khor zug rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /🔽'phags pa dang 'jig rten rab tu rnam par phye ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khor zug ma yin pa dang / khor zug rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir / 'phags pa dang 'jig rten rab tu rnam par phye ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /🔽tshe 'di dang skyes pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba nyid dang / theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la nges pa dang / ma nges pa nas las tha dad pa stong phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /🔽tshe 'di dang skyes pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba nyid dang / theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la nges pa dang / ma nges pa nas las tha dad pa stong phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //

original: de la rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba ni las rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba ni las rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The analysis of nature is twofold:

original: bsam pa dang sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sems pa'o //
translated: intention and volition.

original: thabs rab tu dbye ba ni sems dang lhan cig tu skyes nas bag chags kyi sems dang / tha mi dad pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thabs rab tu dbye ba ni sems dang lhan cig tu skyes nas bag chags kyi sems dang / tha mi dad pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pa'o //
translated: The analysis of means is the means that is born together with the mind and is the cause of the accomplishment of the result that is not different from the mind.

original: 'bras bu sogs pa dang mi sogs pa rab tu dbye ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi las rang gi ngang gis skad cig la 'jig cing 'phel ba dang / rgyus mngon par 'dus byas pa'i las 'jig pa dang 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu sogs pa dang mi sogs pa rab tu dbye ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi las rang gi ngang gis skad cig la 'jig cing 'phel ba dang / rgyus mngon par 'dus byas pa'i las 'jig pa dang 'phel ba'o //
translated: The analysis of the result as accumulated or not accumulated is the result that is accumulated by the karma of the beginningless past that naturally increases from moment to moment and the result that is accumulated by karma that is manifestly accumulated by causes.

original: lan grangs gzhan dang skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan dang skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced in other lives and karma to be experienced after rebirth should also be understood.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The analysis of the antidotes to adverse factors is

original: nag po dang / dkar po dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga'i cha'i las yang dag par len pa rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nag po dang / dkar po dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga'i cha'i las yang dag par len pa rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: the analysis of the correct adoption of black, white, and neither black nor white karma.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye ba ni gnas skabs gsum la nges pa dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / theg pa rnam pa gsum la nges pa dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / theg pa ma yin par 'khor bar nges pa dang /
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye ba ni gnas skabs gsum la nges pa dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / theg pa rnam pa gsum la nges pa dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / theg pa ma yin par 'khor bar nges pa dang /
translated: Ascertainment and nonascertainment is the difference between being certain or not in the three phases, being certain or not in the three kinds of vehicles and being certain of samsara as not being a vehicle.🔽

original: ma nges pa nyid du rig par bya'o //🔽dbang po rnams kyi rgyu ba @235a * //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid du rig par bya'o // dbang po rnams kyi rgyu ba @235a * //
translated: The classification of certainty and uncertainty should be understood in terms of the three states, in terms of the three vehicles, and in terms of the cycle of existence.

original: thibs po bshad pa'i snod rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: thibs po bshad pa'i snod rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching of the classification of the vessel for the explanation of the dense array of the movements of the faculties is as follows:

original: de la dbang po tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said, “Therein, the inferior, middling, and superior faculties are also known as they are in reality.”

original: dbang po 'pho ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dbang po 'pho ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching of the classification of the faculties is as follows:

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said, “The faculties are different in the past and future, and they are not different.”

original: rigs rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rigs rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching of the classification of the lineage is as follows:🔽because it is said, “The lineage is not manifest, is manifest, and is not manifest.”

original: rgya chen po dang / 'bring dang / tha ma nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po dang / 'bring dang / tha ma nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: extensive, middling, and small.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the analysis of defilement is because of the statement:

original: nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is not separate from the passions that arise together with it.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the analysis of certainty and uncertainty is because of the statement:

original: theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid dang / yongs su smin par nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid dang / yongs su smin par nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is certain or uncertain with regard to the vehicle or the non-vehicle, and it is certain or uncertain with regard to complete maturation.

original: 'byung ba rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the analysis of emergence is because of the statement:

original: dbang po'i dra ba'i rjes su 'brang ba dang myur du 'jig pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i dra ba'i rjes su 'brang ba dang myur du 'jig pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is the following of the net of the sense-faculties, it is the quick destruction, and it is the grasping of signs.

original: nyan thos kyi rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the analysis of the purity of the sravakas is because of the statement:

original: dbang po'i dbang gis mi brdzi ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i dbang gis mi brdzi ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is not overcome by the power of the sense-faculties.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye bas ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the analysis of the purity of the bodhisattva is stated because

original: dbang po bzlog tu rung ba dang / bzlog tu mi rung ba rab tu rnam par dbye ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po bzlog tu rung ba dang / bzlog tu mi rung ba rab tu rnam par dbye ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: the faculties are to be distinguished as those that can be overcome and those that cannot be overcome.

original: dbang po thams cad bsdu bar rab tu dbye bas ston te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad bsdu bar rab tu dbye bas ston te gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the analysis of the inclusion of all faculties is stated because

original: ring du song ba dang lhan cig skyes pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa nyid nas mdor bsdu na dbang po tha dad pa nyid stong phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ring du song ba dang lhan cig skyes pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa nyid nas mdor bsdu na dbang po tha dad pa nyid stong phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he knows in accordance with reality the various differences of the faculties that have gone far, the innate, and so forth, up to the many thousands of different faculties in brief.

original: de la dbang po 'pho ba rab tu dbye ba ni snga ma 'bogs pa dang / snga ma rnams las phyi ma rnams dma' ba dang / khyad par du 'phags pa nyid dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po 'pho ba rab tu dbye ba ni snga ma 'bogs pa dang / snga ma rnams las phyi ma rnams dma' ba dang / khyad par du 'phags pa nyid dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The analysis of the movement of the faculties should be understood by way of the movement of the former faculties and the movement of the latter faculties, which are respectively lower, higher, and equal.

original: rigs rab tu dbye ba ni theg pa gsum gyi rigs rab tu dbye ba'o //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: rigs rab tu dbye ba ni theg pa gsum gyi rigs rab tu dbye ba'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The analysis of the spiritual gene is the analysis of the spiritual genes of the three vehicles.

original: yid dang bde ba la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal nyid do //
analyzed: yid dang bde ba la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal nyid do //
translated: The analysis of addiction is the addictions of the mental organ and the faculties of pleasure, etc., as well as the envelopment and instinctual addictions.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye ba ni theg pa gsum po dag dang / 'khor bar nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid dang / yongs su smin par nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye ba ni theg pa gsum po dag dang / 'khor bar nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid dang / yongs su smin par nges pa nyid do //
translated: The analysis of certainty and uncertainty is the certainty and uncertainty of the three vehicles in cyclic existence, and the certainty of evolutionary maturity.

original: @235b de la sems can theg pa dman par ma nges pa rnams kyi dbang po dag ni byang chub sems dpas zlog par byed do //
analyzed: @235b de la sems can theg pa dman par ma nges pa rnams kyi dbang po dag ni byang chub sems dpas zlog par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva turns away the faculties of beings who are uncertain about the lower vehicle.

original: theg pa chen por ma nges pa rnams ni nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen por ma nges pa rnams ni nges par byed pa'o //
translated: He causes those uncertain about the universal vehicle to be certain.

original: gcig tu shin tu nges pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar byed do //
analyzed: gcig tu shin tu nges pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar byed do //
translated: He liberates those who are certain in the one way.

original: yongs su smin par nges pa rnams la ni btang snyoms su byed do //
analyzed: yongs su smin par nges pa rnams la ni btang snyoms su byed do //
translated: And he remains indifferent to those who are certain of their evolutionary development.

original: 'byung ba rab tu dbye ba ni 'byung ba rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba rab tu dbye ba ni 'byung ba rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The differentiation of the elements should be understood as threefold:

original: rten 'byung ba ni skye mched drug po dag phan tshun 'brel par rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: rten 'byung ba ni skye mched drug po dag phan tshun 'brel par rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: The element of support is the six sense-spheres, which are mutually connected and follow one another.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa 'byung ba ni myur du 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa 'byung ba ni myur du 'jig pa'o //
translated: The element of origination and destruction is the rapid destruction of what is born.

original: dmigs pa las byung ba ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa las byung ba ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The element of objective reference is the apprehension of signs.

original: nyan thos kyi rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba ni lam gyi dbang gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba ni lam gyi dbang gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba'i don to //
translated: The differentiation of the purification of the Sravaka is for the purpose of victory over adverse elements by means of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba ni phyir ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba ni phyir ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The differentiation of the purification of the Bodhisattva is the differentiation of the stages of the non-returning and the returning.

original: dbang po thams cad bsdus pa rab tu dbye ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i dbang bo rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad bsdus pa rab tu dbye ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i dbang bo rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The differentiation of the inclusion of all faculties should be understood as the differentiation of the faculties that are acquired through preparatory effort and those that are innate.

original: mos pa dang / khams dang / bsam pa rnams kyi chung du dang / 'bring dang chen po la sogs rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pas kyang rab tu dbye bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa dang / khams dang / bsam pa rnams kyi chung du dang / 'bring dang chen po la sogs rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pas kyang rab tu dbye bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the differences in the inclinations, the elements, and the aspirations of sentient beings are infinite.

original: gang gi phyir de mos pa rnams kyi chung du dang / 'bring dang / rab nyid rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa nas mos pa tha dad pa stong phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de mos pa rnams kyi chung du dang / 'bring dang / rab nyid rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa nas mos pa tha dad pa stong phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he knows well the lesser, middling, and greater inclinations of sentient beings, up to the different inclinations of many thousands of sentient beings.

original: khams rnams dang bsam pa rnams kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: khams rnams dang bsam pa rnams kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The elements and aspirations of sentient beings should be understood in the same way.

original: de la bag la nyal ni rjes su 'brang ba'i don du rig par bya'o//
analyzed: de la bag la nyal ni rjes su 'brang ba'i don du rig par bya'o//
translated: Among them, the latent states should be understood as the meaning of following.

original: de dag gi rgyu ba thibs po'i dbye ba ni gang du rjes su 'brang ba dang / ji ltar rjes su 'brang ba de'i rab tu dbye bas ston to //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ba thibs po'i dbye ba ni gang du rjes su 'brang ba dang / ji ltar rjes su 'brang ba de'i rab tu dbye bas ston to //
translated: The divisions of their thick movement are taught by the divisions of where they follow and how they follow.

original: gang du rjes su 'brang zhe na /
analyzed: gang du rjes su 'brang zhe na /
translated: Where do they follow?

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i sems la ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i sems la ste /
translated: in a mind that is karmically ripening and in a mind that is not karmically ripening.

original: gang gi phyir de la bag la nyal rnams kyi bsam pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / sems dang lhan cig skyes pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la bag la nyal rnams kyi bsam pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / sems dang lhan cig skyes pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he knows as it truly is the latent impressions of the latent afflictions, their co-arising with the mind, and their co-arising with the mind itself.

original: ji ltar rjes su 'brang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su 'brang zhe na /
translated: How does he follow them?

original: rjes su 'brang ba rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six kinds of following:

original: rjes su 'brang ba rnam pa drug la bar med par rnam pa sna tshogs yun ring pe nas rjes su 'brang @236a * //🔽ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba rnam pa drug la bar med par rnam pa sna tshogs yun ring pe nas rjes su 'brang @236a * // ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The following of various kinds for a long time without interruption is what is meant by

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba dang / ring nas rjes su zhugs pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa rnam par dbye ba dang / ring nas rjes su zhugs pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: because he knows the co-arising of the mind and mental factors.

original: dang po nyid du rjes su 'brang ba ni tshig gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: dang po nyid du rjes su 'brang ba ni tshig gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: Following from the very beginning is taught by two phrases:

original: gang gi phyir thog ma med pa'i dus nas ma bsal ba nyid dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyom par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad kyis mi mjed pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //

translated: Because it is not eliminated from beginningless time, and because it is not overcome by any of the meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative attainments, meditative absorptions, or superknowledges.

original: khams dang sems dang yul thams cad du song bas rjes su 'brang ba ni tshig gsum gyis ston te /
analyzed: khams dang sems dang yul thams cad du song bas rjes su 'brang ba ni tshig gsum gyis ston te /

original: gang gi phyir khams gsum pa'i mtshams sbyar bar mtshams sbyor bas shin tu 'brel pa nyid dang / thog ma med pa'i dus nas sems bcings par kun du 'byung ba nyid dang / skye mched kyi sgo nas rnam par rig pa 'byung ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /

analyzed: ming dang gzugs lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa zhes gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: 'phel ba dang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /

analyzed: srid pa la mgo rmongs pa dang / srid pas mngon par 'dod pas mtshams sbyor ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is said: “The members are the conditions for the arising of birth, because of the delusion of existence and the desire for existence.”

original: kun 'byung ba dang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It is taught by means of the various formulations of the truths of origination and suffering, because🔽it is said: “The members are the conditions for the arising of birth, because of the delusion of existence and the desire for existence.”

original: spyod pa 'dod pa dang / skye bar 'dod pa dang / sems can la dga' ba dang / thog ma dang tha ma med par khams gsum pa 'dzin pa dang / 'du shes 'dren pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa 'dod pa dang / skye bar 'dod pa dang / sems can la dga' ba dang / thog ma dang tha ma med par khams gsum pa 'dzin pa dang / 'du shes 'dren pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He knows well the desire for activity, the desire for rebirth, the fondness for sentient beings, the grasping of the three realms as without beginning or end, and the very bringing about of discriminations.

original: de la spyod par 'dod pa nyid kyis ni dga' ba can dang / 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba ston to //
analyzed: de la spyod par 'dod pa nyid kyis ni dga' ba can dang / 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba ston to //
translated: Here, the desire for activity shows the delight in, and attachment to, various things.

original: skye ba 'dod pa nyid kyis ni yang srid pa pa ston to //
analyzed: skye ba 'dod pa nyid kyis ni yang srid pa pa ston to //
translated: The desire for rebirth shows the existence of a new birth.

original: sems can la dga' bas ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi srid pa ston to //
analyzed: sems can la dga' bas ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi srid pa ston to //
translated: The fondness for sentient beings shows the existence characterized by attachment to one’s own and others’ lifestreams.

original: 'gro ba dang / 'ongs pa khams gong ma dang / 'og ma 'dzin pa dang / chung ba dang / rgya chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / ci yang med pa'i 'du shes 'dren pas srid pa'i 'khor lo yongs su 'khor bas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ston to //

translated: and the arising of the notion of the small and the great, and the notion of the infinite, and the notion of nothing at all, he demonstrates the establishment of the truth of suffering, by the turning of the wheel of existence.

original: bag chags rnams kyi rgyu ba thibs po rab tu dbye ba las 'bras bu 'byin par nye bar gnas pa dang / nye bar mi gnas pa'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /

translated: He demonstrates the distinction of the thick going of the latent impressions, in terms of the difference of the presence and absence of the giving of fruit, because

translated: He demonstrates the distinction of the latent impressions of the world, because

analyzed: mthar gyis lhag par bsgos pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: because of the gradual, special impregnations,

original: ring du song ba'i bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pas nyon mongs pa 'grib par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ring du song ba'i bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pas nyon mongs pa 'grib par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: the afflictions are diminished by the uninterrupted continuum of the afflictions of the impregnations that have gone far.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i bag chags kyi bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i bag chags kyi bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the particularities of the impregnations of mundane renunciation is that,

original: ring du song bas rgyun mi 'chad la nyon mongs pa 'grib par byid pas bsgos pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ring du song bas rgyun mi 'chad la nyon mongs pa 'grib par byid pas bsgos pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: because of the uninterrupted impregnations that have gone far, the afflictions are diminished.

original: chos 'di pa dang gzhan mu stegs can gyi thar pa'i tshogs kyi bag chags kyi bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: chos 'di pa dang gzhan mu stegs can gyi thar pa'i tshogs kyi bag chags kyi bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the particularities of the impregnations of the accumulations of liberation of this dharma and of the tīrthikas is that,

original: rdzas su gyur pa dang rdzas su ma gyur pas bsgos pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas su gyur pa dang rdzas su ma gyur pas bsgos pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: because of the impregnations that have become substantial and have not become substantial,

original: theg pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: theg pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: the teaching by way of the particularities of the impregnations of the vehicles is that,🔽because of the impregnations of the vehicles of the hearers and so on,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / thos pa dang 'grogs pas bsgos pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / thos pa dang 'grogs pas bsgos pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He also knows just as it is the impressions of seeing, hearing, and associating with śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas.

original: sems can gyi tshogs gsum gyi rgyu ba thibs po rab tu dbye ba las yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can dang / yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can theg pa gsum la gcig tu nges pa dang / gcig tu ma nges pa'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs gsum gyi rgyu ba thibs po rab tu dbye ba las yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can dang / yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can theg pa gsum la gcig tu nges pa dang / gcig tu ma nges pa'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He teaches the three groups of sentient beings, those with the dharma of complete nirvana, those without the dharma of complete nirvana, and those of the three vehicles who are definitely fixed and not definitely fixed, by means of the distinctions in the thickets of the three kinds of conduct.

original: de sems can gyi tshogs yang dag pa @237b nyid du nges pa nyid dang / log pa nyid du nges pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bas nges pa med pa nyed kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de sems can gyi tshogs yang dag pa @237b nyid du nges pa nyid dang / log pa nyid du nges pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bas nges pa med pa nyed kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He knows just as it is the definite reality of the group of sentient beings, the indefinite reality of the group of sentient beings, and the reality of the group of sentient beings that is free from both.

original: legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i rgyu'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i rgyu'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the specific causes of good conduct and bad conduct is that,

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas yang dag pa la nges pa nyid dang / log pa'i lta bas log par nges pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bas nges pa med kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas yang dag pa la nges pa nyid dang / log pa'i lta bas log par nges pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bas nges pa med kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because of right view, one is certain about what is right, because of wrong view, one is certain about what is wrong, and because of being free from both of those, one is not certain, but one does know what is right just as it is.

original: ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro'i rgyu'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ngan 'gro dang bde 'gro'i rgyu'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the specific causes of bad transmigration and good transmigration is that,

original: mtshams med pa lnga gang yang rung ba zhig tu log par nges pa nyid dang / dbang po lnga la yang dag par nges pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bas nges pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga gang yang rung ba zhig tu log par nges pa nyid dang / dbang po lnga la yang dag par nges pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bas nges pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: because of any one of the five heinous actions, one is certain about bad transmigration, because of the five faculties, one is certain about good transmigration, and because of being free from both of those, one is certain.

original: mu stegs can dang / 'phags pa nyan thos kyi rgyu'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: mu stegs can dang / 'phags pa nyan thos kyi rgyu'i bye brag gis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the specific causes of the tīrthikas and noble śrāvakas is that,🔽because of the five faculties, one is certain about the noble śrāvakas, and because of being free from those, one is certain about the tīrthikas.

original: log pa brgyad du log par nges pa nyid dang / yang dag pa la yang dag par nges pa nyid dang / yang byar med pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bar nges pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: log pa brgyad du log par nges pa nyid dang / yang dag pa la yang dag par nges pa nyid dang / yang byar med pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bar nges pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: and the absence of determination in the two, the determined and the undetermined.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bye brag gis kyang ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bye brag gis kyang ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching by way of the bodhisattva is stated:

original: ser sna dang / phrag dog dang / ngan pa spyod pa ma bzlog pas log par nges pa nyid dang / 'phags pa bla na med pa'i lam bsgom pa nye bar sgrub pas yang dag par nges pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bas nges pa med pa'i phung po la lung 'bogs pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna dang / phrag dog dang / ngan pa spyod pa ma bzlog pas log par nges pa nyid dang / 'phags pa bla na med pa'i lam bsgom pa nye bar sgrub pas yang dag par nges pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga dang bral bas nges pa med pa'i phung po la lung 'bogs pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because of the absence of the reversal of stinginess, jealousy, and bad conduct, there is the determined; because of the accomplishment of the cultivation of the noble, unsurpassed path, there is the undetermined; and because of the absence of both, there is the absence of determination.🔽The teaching by way of the aggregates is stated:

original: de la ser snas don du gnyer ba'i sems can yal bar 'dor ba dang / phrag dog gi nyes pas sems can gzhan sbyor bar mi 'dod pa dang / ngan pa nye bar spyod pa ma bzlog pas gzhan la sdug bsngal nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pas byang chub sems dpa'i log pa nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ser snas don du gnyer ba'i sems can yal bar 'dor ba dang / phrag dog gi nyes pas sems can gzhan sbyor bar mi 'dod pa dang / ngan pa nye bar spyod pa ma bzlog pas gzhan la sdug bsngal nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pas byang chub sems dpa'i log pa nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva's error is to abandon beings who are greedy for gain, to not want to associate with other beings because of the fault of jealousy, and to inflict suffering on others because of not turning away from bad behavior.

original: de ltar smra ba po'i rtsol ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis sa 'di la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar smra ba po'i rtsol ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis sa 'di la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in this stage is endowed with three causes: the perfection of the speaker's effort, the perfection of knowledge, and the perfection of engagement in practice.

original: rab tu gnas nas thar pa nye bar sgrub pa'i sgo nas bshad pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /🔽gang gi phyir kye rgyal @238a * //
analyzed: rab tu gnas nas thar pa nye bar sgrub pa'i sgo nas bshad pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /🔽gang gi phyir kye rgyal @238a * //
translated: Having been established, he becomes endowed with the perfection of explanation through the attainment of liberation.🔽O King, the bodhisattva who is established in this stage is endowed with three causes: the perfection of the speaker's effort, the perfection of knowledge, and the perfection of engagement in practice. Having been established, he becomes endowed with the perfection of explanation through the attainment of liberation.

original: ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is endowed with such knowledge is said to be well-established in the bodhisattva stage called Good Intelligence.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni sems can rnams kyi spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa de lta bu dag shes nas de bzhin du thar pa nye bar sgrub pa nye bar sgrub bo zhes
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni sems can rnams kyi spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa de lta bu dag shes nas de bzhin du thar pa nye bar sgrub pa nye bar sgrub bo zhes
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in this bodhisattva stage called Good Intelligence, having known such different kinds of conduct of sentient beings, establishes them in the attainment of liberation in just that way.

original: gsungs pa'o // bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa de yang shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ngag phun sum tshogs pa dang / smra ba po phun sum tshogs pa dang rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: gsungs pa'o // bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa de yang shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ngag phun sum tshogs pa dang / smra ba po phun sum tshogs pa dang rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su bstan to //
translated: This excellence of explanation is also taught by way of the three kinds of excellence: the excellence of knowledge, the excellence of speech, and the excellence of the speaker.

original: shes pa phun sum tshogs pa de yang gang zhig shes pa dang / gang gi dbang du byas nas de bstan pas ston par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa phun sum tshogs pa de yang gang zhig shes pa dang / gang gi dbang du byas nas de bstan pas ston par rig par bya'o //
translated: The excellence of knowledge should be understood by way of what is known and by way of the teaching that is demonstrated by the one who has that knowledge.

original: ci zhig shes nas ston zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig shes nas ston zhe na /
translated: What is taught through knowing what?

original: yongs su smin par gyur pas rnam par grol ba'i snod nyid dang / 'dul bas rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin dang theg pa gsum tha dad pas rnam par grol ba rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin par gyur pas rnam par grol ba'i snod nyid dang / 'dul bas rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin dang theg pa gsum tha dad pas rnam par grol ba rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The nature of complete liberation as a vessel through complete maturation, the nature of complete liberation through discipline, and the classification of complete liberation through the different vehicles.

original: gang gi phyir sems can yongs su smin pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can yongs su smin pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Because he knows perfectly the complete maturation of sentient beings,

original: sems can gdul ba dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa bstan pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bstan pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gdul ba dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa bstan pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bstan pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he knows perfectly the discipline of sentient beings, the teaching of the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the teaching of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, the teaching of the Bodhisattva Vehicle, and the teaching of the ground of the Tathāgata.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas ston zhe na /🔽gnyen po bstan pa'i snod nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas ston zhe na / gnyen po bstan pa'i snod nyid de /
translated: With regard to whom is it taught?🔽The vessel for teaching the antidotes.

original: gdul bya'i snod la brtags nas gnyen po ston zhes bya ba'i tha chig ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i snod la brtags nas gnyen po ston zhes bya ba'i tha chig ste /
translated: Having examined the vessel of the disciple, the antidote is taught.

original: tshig gnyis dang / dbang po dang / mos pa dang mthun par chos ston pas chos ston pa'i snod ni tshig gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: tshig gnyis dang / dbang po dang / mos pa dang mthun par chos ston pas chos ston pa'i snod ni tshig gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: The vessel for teaching the Dharma is taught by two phrases: in accordance with the faculties and in accordance with the inclinations.

original: gang gi phyir de de ltar shes nas sems can rnams la de kho na bzhin du chos ston te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de ltar shes nas sems can rnams la de kho na bzhin du chos ston te /
translated: Because, having understood in that way, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in just that way.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba rnam par dbye ba dang / bag la nyal ji lta ba rnam par dbye ba dang / dbang po ji lta ba rnam par dbye ba dang / mos pa ji lta ba rnam par dbye ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba rnam par dbye ba dang / bag la nyal ji lta ba rnam par dbye ba dang / dbang po ji lta ba rnam par dbye ba dang / mos pa ji lta ba rnam par dbye ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: As stated: “The classification according to the attitude, the classification according to the latent tendencies, the classification according to the faculties, and the classification according to the inclinations.”

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the example?

original: nye bar sgrub pa'i snod nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: nye bar sgrub pa'i snod nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The vessel for accomplishment is because

original: spyod yul ji lta ba bzhin dbye ba shes pa nye bar sgrub pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul ji lta ba bzhin dbye ba shes pa nye bar sgrub pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the classification according to the domain is accomplished.

original: rnam grangs ji lta bu'i snod @238b nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs ji lta bu'i snod @238b nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: What is the vessel for the categories? It is because

original: spyod yul thams cad shes pa khong du chud par bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul thams cad shes pa khong du chud par bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of all domains is comprehended.

original: ji snyed thob pa'i snod nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ji snyed thob pa'i snod nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The vessel for the attainment of the various is taught by the words:

original: khams kyi thibs po ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //🔽skye ba der nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi bag chags 'dra bas tshig gzung bar 'os pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: khams kyi thibs po ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o // skye ba der nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi bag chags 'dra bas tshig gzung bar 'os pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: in accordance with the density of the elements.🔽The resemblance to the latent impressions of the afflictions and karma in that rebirth is taught by the words:

original: skye bar nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bag chags ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skye bar nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bag chags ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: in accordance with the latent impressions of the afflictions and karma.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa'i dbang po rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa'i dbang po rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The reversal of the faculties that are certain and uncertain is taught by the words:

original: tshogs ji lta bu la gnas pa khong du chud par bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //🔽theg pa ji lta bus nges par 'byin pa'i snod nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: tshogs ji lta bu la gnas pa khong du chud par bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o // theg pa ji lta bus nges par 'byin pa'i snod nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: in accordance with the understanding of the accumulations.🔽The vessel for the deliverance by the various vehicles is taught by the words:

original: theg pa ji lta bu la mos pa'i rnam par grol ba thob par bya ba chos ston to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa ji lta bu la mos pa'i rnam par grol ba thob par bya ba chos ston to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the Dharma for the attainment of liberation in accordance with the faith in the various vehicles.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos smra ba chen po byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos smra ba chen po byed cing /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this Excellent Wisdom bodhisattva stage acts as a great Dharma teacher.🔽He guards the Tathagata's Dharma treasure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod bsrung ngo zhes bya bas ni 'chad pa po nyid dang / 'dzin pa po nyid du yongs su ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod bsrung ngo zhes bya bas ni 'chad pa po nyid dang / 'dzin pa po nyid du yongs su ston to //
translated: This shows him to be both a teacher and a holder.🔽He is endowed with the manner of a Dharma teacher.

original: de chos smra ba'i tshul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shus gtam brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de chos smra ba'i tshul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa nyi shus gtam brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the twentyfold expression of his teaching.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty kinds?

original: dus dang / gus par byed pa dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / mthun par ldan pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / mos par byed pa dang / tshim par byed pa dang / brtun ngas par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: dus dang / gus par byed pa dang / go rims dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / mthun par ldan pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / mos par byed pa dang / tshim par byed pa dang / brtun ngas par mi byed pa dang /
translated: He teaches at the proper time, respectfully, in sequence, with a connection, in a manner that is consistent, in a manner that delights, in a manner that inspires confidence, in a manner that satisfies, in a manner that is not overbearing, and in a manner that is not low-minded.

original: g-yel bar mi byed pa dang / rigs pa dang mthun pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba dang / byams ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: g-yel bar mi byed pa dang / rigs pa dang mthun pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba dang / byams ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He is not distracted, he is reasonable, he is not confused, he is in accord with the Dharma, he is in accord with the assembly, he has a mind of loving-kindness, he has a mind of benefit, he has a mind of compassion,

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams la mi gnas pa dang / bdag la mi stod cing gzhan la mi smod pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams la mi gnas pa dang / bdag la mi stod cing gzhan la mi smod pa'o //
translated: he is not attached to gain, honor, or praise, he does not praise himself, and he does not disparage others.

original: de la dus ni mi khom pa brgyad dang ma 'brel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la dus ni mi khom pa brgyad dang ma 'brel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Here, the time is not connected with the eight inopportune situations.🔽For example,

original: dper na / mya ngan gyis gdungs rims btab 'khrugs pa yul la mngon phyogs rnam par nyam ngar gnas //
analyzed: dper na / mya ngan gyis gdungs rims btab 'khrugs pa yul la mngon phyogs rnam par nyam ngar gnas //
translated: one who is afflicted with grief, one who is sick, one who is disturbed, one who is preoccupied with worldly affairs, one who is in a state of confusion,

original: sgo ba med cing srung ma med dang phra ma zhugs dang sgrub pa med pa yi //
analyzed: sgo ba med cing srung ma med dang phra ma zhugs dang sgrub pa med pa yi //
translated: one who has no doorkeeper or guard, one who is divisive, one who is not established,

original: rgyal po la ni yul dus shes pa ji ltar rang don brjod pa mi 'dod @239a * //
analyzed: rgyal po la ni yul dus shes pa ji ltar rang don brjod pa mi 'dod @239a * //
translated: a king who knows the time and place, one who does not wish to speak for one's own benefit,

original: ltar ; / sems kyi rgyal po mi khom brgyad dang 'brel pa la yang tshul ni de nyid do //
analyzed: ltar ; / sems kyi rgyal po mi khom brgyad dang 'brel pa la yang tshul ni de nyid do //
translated: The same method applies to the king of minds, even when it is connected with the eight inopportune states.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The same method applies to the king of minds, even when it is associated with the eight inopportune states.

original: gus par byed ces bya ba ni mthun pa'i spyod lam gyis gnas pa la yin gyi /
analyzed: gus par byed ces bya ba ni mthun pa'i spyod lam gyis gnas pa la yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “with respect” means with a compatible physical behavior.

original: mi mthun pas ma yin te /🔽ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pas ma yin te / ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: It does not mean with a incompatible behavior.

original: min bar 'dug pa 'greng ste /
analyzed: min bar 'dug pa 'greng ste /
translated: What is compatible and what is incompatible?🔽You should not explain the Dharma to someone who is lying down, who is standing, or who is seated on a high seat.

original: chos mi bshad par bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa so sor thar pa'i mdo las bslab pa'i chos rnams kyi nang nas ji ltar rgya cher 'byung ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos mi bshad par bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa so sor thar pa'i mdo las bslab pa'i chos rnams kyi nang nas ji ltar rgya cher 'byung ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: You should know the rules of proper behavior as they are explained in the scriptures on discipline.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos gtso bor mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos gtso bor mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas revere the Dharma.

original: chos la gus par byas na gzhan dag kyang chos la shin tu gus pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: chos la gus par byas na gzhan dag kyang chos la shin tu gus pa skye ba'o //
translated: When you revere the Dharma, others will also develop great reverence for the Dharma.

original: nyan pa dag kyang gus pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyan pa dag kyang gus pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: When you revere the Dharma, those who listen to you will also develop reverence.

original: brnyas pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brnyas pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not develop contempt for the Dharma.

original: de ltar gus par byas nas ston pa de chos la ser sna byed pa'i dri ma med pas thams cad la thams cad ston to //
analyzed: de ltar gus par byas nas ston pa de chos la ser sna byed pa'i dri ma med pas thams cad la thams cad ston to //
translated: Thus, having shown respect, the teacher teaches everything to everyone, since he is free from the stain of stinginess with regard to the Dharma.

original: slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud byed pas rgyun chags su ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud byed pas rgyun chags su ston to //
translated: The teacher teaches uninterruptedly, since he is free from the fault of being miserly with the Dharma.

original: go rims zhes bya ba ni tshig dan gyi ge go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'o //
analyzed: go rims zhes bya ba ni tshig dan gyi ge go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'o //
translated: Order means teaching in accordance with the order of the words and syllables.

original: mtshams sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i go rims bzhin du don rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i go rims bzhin du don rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Connection means explaining the meaning in accordance with the order of the words and syllables.

original: mthun pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan par chos ston gyi /
analyzed: mthun pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan par chos ston gyi /
translated: Possessing harmony means teaching the Dharma with a meaning that is

original: don dang mi ldan par ma yin te /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan par ma yin te /
translated: not without a meaning.

original: de la don nyid ston gyi don dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la don nyid ston gyi don dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therein, he teaches the meaning, not that which is without meaning.

original: dga' bar byed ces bya ba ni yang dag bar bstan par bya ba rnams la yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: dga' bar byed ces bya ba ni yang dag bar bstan par bya ba rnams la yang dag par ston to //
translated: He delights means that he teaches correctly those who are to be taught correctly.

original: mos par byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya ba rnams yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mos par byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya ba rnams yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase he causes them to be interested means that he causes those who are to be caused to take up the Dharma to take it up.

original: tshim par byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya ba rnams yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'o //
analyzed: tshim par byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya ba rnams yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'o //
translated: The phrase he satisfies means that he satisfies those who are to be caused to rejoice.

original: brtun ngas par mi byed pa dang g-yel bar mi byed ces bya ba rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis ni dga' bar bya ba rnams dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtun ngas par mi byed pa dang g-yel bar mi byed ces bya ba rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis ni dga' bar bya ba rnams dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase he does not become weary or discouraged means that he does not become weary or discouraged in causing those who are to be disciplined to be disciplined.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma dang ldan pa'i gtam zer ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma dang ldan pa'i gtam zer ba'o //
translated: The phrase he speaks appropriately means that he speaks with the three kinds of valid cognition: perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror 'gro ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror 'gro ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: The phrase he speaks suitably means that he speaks in a manner that is consistent with the attainment of happy rebirths.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'khrugs pa go sla ba gzing gzing ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'khrugs pa go sla ba gzing gzing ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase he speaks in a way that is free of confusion means that he speaks in a way that is not confused, that is easy to understand, and that is not verbose.

original: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan @239b pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan @239b pa'o //
translated: The phrase he speaks in a way that is consistent with the Dharma means that he speaks in a way that is consistent with the four noble truths.

original: 'khor ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni bzhi'am brgyang de /
analyzed: 'khor ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni bzhi'am brgyang de /
translated: As to the retinue, it is fourfold or tenfold.

original: gang la ji ltar gang 'ongs pa de la de ltar de brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la ji ltar gang 'ongs pa de la de ltar de brjod pa'o //
translated: One should speak to them in whatever way is appropriate, according to the case.

original: rnam pa bco lnga po de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don thams cad dang mthun pa'i gtam du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bco lnga po de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don thams cad dang mthun pa'i gtam du shes par bya'o //
translated: By these fifteen aspects, the bodhisattva's discourse is to be known as being in accord with all the aims of others.

original: de'i 'og tu byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la byams pa'i sems nyid nye bar gzhag nas gtam brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la byams pa'i sems nyid nye bar gzhag nas gtam brjod pa'o //
translated: Then, with a mind of loving kindness means that one should speak with a mind of loving kindness toward those sentient beings who are harmful.

original: phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With a mind of helpfulness means

original: nye bar spyad pa spyod pa'i sems can rnams phan par bya ba'i sems nyid nye bar gzhag nas so //
analyzed: nye bar spyad pa spyod pa'i sems can rnams phan par bya ba'i sems nyid nye bar gzhag nas so //
translated: that one should speak with a mind of helpfulness toward those sentient beings who are practicing helpful conduct.

original: snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal bas rgyags pa dang / sro shi ba'i sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba dang snying brtse ba'i sems nyid nye bar gzhag nas so //
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal bas rgyags pa dang / sro shi ba'i sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba dang snying brtse ba'i sems nyid nye bar gzhag nas so //
translated: The phrase with a mind of loving-kindness means that, having established a mind of loving-kindness, a mind of compassion, and a mind of sympathy toward those sentient beings who are arrogant because of their happiness and those who are depressed because of their suffering, one teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad la re ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad la re ba med pa'o //
translated: The phrase not dwelling on gain, honor, or fame means that, with a mind free of material desire, one does not seek gain, honor, or fame.

original: bdag la mi stod cing gzhan la mi smod ces bya ba ni nga rgyal dang / phrag dog gis kun nas dkris pa dang bral bar sems can rnams la chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la mi stod cing gzhan la mi smod ces bya ba ni nga rgyal dang / phrag dog gis kun nas dkris pa dang bral bar sems can rnams la chos ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase not praising oneself and not disparaging others means that, free of the entanglements of pride and jealousy, one teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi sems yongs su dag pa'i gtam du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi sems yongs su dag pa'i gtam du shes par bya'o //
translated: These five aspects should be understood as the bodhisattvas’ discourse that is purified of the five mental states.

original: de ltar na rnam pa nyi shus gtam brjod pas chos smra ba'i tshul dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa nyi shus gtam brjod pas chos smra ba'i tshul dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by means of these twenty aspects, the bodhisattva is endowed with the method of teaching the Dharma.

original: de la ngag phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i tshig gis chos ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ngag phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i tshig gis chos ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Regarding this, the perfection of speech is the teaching of the Dharma by means of the words that are accomplished by the bodhisattva’s analytical knowledges.

original: gang gi phyir shes pas sa la mkhas pa tshad med pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pas sa la mkhas pa tshad med pa dang ldan pas /
translated: Because of his immeasurable skill in the stages of knowledge,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis mngon par bsgrubs pas chos ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis mngon par bsgrubs pas chos ston to //
translated: the bodhisattva teaches the Dharma by means of the words that are accomplished by the four analytical knowledges.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ma 'dres pa dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ma 'dres pa dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Regarding this, the four unmixed analytical knowledges of the bodhisattva always and continuously occur, they are:

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rtag par rgyun du 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rtag par rgyun du 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the analytical knowledge of the Dharma, the analytical knowledge of the meaning, the analytical knowledge of clear expression, and the analytical knowledge of confidence.

original: ma 'dres pa de dag ces bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa de dag ces bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase “those that are not common” refers to those that are not shared.

original: de la so so yang dag par rig pa rnams @240a * //
analyzed: de la so so yang dag par rig pa rnams @240a * //
translated: The objects of the analytical knowledges🔽are reality, the domain of reality,

original: kyi yul ni chos nyid dang / chos nyid spyod yul kho na dang / go bar byed pa dang / go bar byed pa sgo du ma kho na'o //
analyzed: kyi yul ni chos nyid dang / chos nyid spyod yul kho na dang / go bar byed pa dang / go bar byed pa sgo du ma kho na'o //
translated: that which is to be understood, and the means of understanding.

original: de la chos nyid ni gang mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i rigs kyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos nyid ni gang mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i rigs kyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Reality is that which is included in the categories, being free from the two extremes.

original: 'di lta ste dper na gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽chos nyid spyod yul kho na rigs kyis bsdus pa de nyid ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // chos nyid spyod yul kho na rigs kyis bsdus pa de nyid ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: For example, the definition of form is “that which is capable of materiality.”🔽The domain of reality is that which is included in the categories, being the object of knowledge as it really is.

original: rigs kyis bsdus pa de ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rigs kyis bsdus pa de ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which is included in the categories is the object of knowledge as it really is.

original: 'di lta ste dper na gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: For example, “What is form?

original: ming dang gzugs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the material and the elements of materiality.”🔽That which is to be understood is that which is included in the categories, being the object of knowledge as it is in its diversity.

original: go bar byed pa ni ji ltar shes pa'i yul de nyid brjod pas gzhan khong du chud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: go bar byed pa ni ji ltar shes pa'i yul de nyid brjod pas gzhan khong du chud par byed pa ste /
translated: The means of understanding is the expression of the object of knowledge, which causes others to understand.

original: gzhan dag brjod pas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag brjod pas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Others are caused to understand through expression.

original: go bar byed pa sgo du ma nyid ni brjod pas gzhan khong du chud pa de nyid kyi rnam grangs tshad med pa shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: go bar byed pa sgo du ma nyid ni brjod pas gzhan khong du chud pa de nyid kyi rnam grangs tshad med pa shes pa nyid do //
translated: The means of understanding is the knowledge of the synonyms of that very expression which causes others to understand, which is immeasurable.

original: de dag ni rnam pa bcur rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa bcur rnam par gnas te /
translated: They are established in ten aspects.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / tshul gyi mtshan nyid dang / bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / tshul gyi mtshan nyid dang / bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five aspects of the characteristics of the knowable: the characteristic of the nature of phenomena, the characteristic of the general nature, the characteristic of the mode, the characteristic of teaching, the characteristic of knowledge, and the characteristic of complete purification.

original: 'di lta ste mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / theg pa dman pa dang / gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i mdzad pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽rigs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sgra ji bzhin du ming du bgrangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ming de'i rab tu dbye ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid de gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / theg pa dman pa dang / gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i mdzad pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do // de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste / rigs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sgra ji bzhin du ming du bgrangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ming de'i rab tu dbye ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid de gang gi phyir /
