original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bhūmi Cloud of Dharma, in a single instant, a single moment, a single occasion,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig las chos kyi snang ba dang / gsal ba dang / sprin chen po chos kyi dbyings dus gsum gyi mdzod ces bya ba bzod /🔽yang dag par len /🔽bdag gir byed /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig las chos kyi snang ba dang / gsal ba dang / sprin chen po chos kyi dbyings dus gsum gyi mdzod ces bya ba bzod / yang dag par len / bdag gir byed /
translated: receives from a single tathāgata the great cloud of the Dharma, the great illumination of the Dharma, and the great cloud of the Dharma called the treasury of the dharmadhātu of the three times.🔽He accepts it,🔽he takes it up,

original: yang dag par 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin te /
translated: he holds it.

original: chos kyi snang ba dang / gsal ba dang / sprin chen po yang dag par 'dzin pa @255a * //🔽la mkhas pa de la /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba dang / gsal ba dang / sprin chen po yang dag par 'dzin pa @255a * // la mkhas pa de la /
translated: The skill in holding the great cloud of the illumination of the Dharma

original: thos pa la mkhas pa snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: thos pa la mkhas pa snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: is such that the previous skill in learning does not even reach a hundredth part of it.

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang /
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang /
translated: a thousandth part, a hundred thousandth part, a ten millionth part, a thousand millionth part, a ten thousand millionth part, a million millionth part, a ten million millionth part, a hundred million millionth part, a thousand million millionth part, a hundred thousand million millionth part, a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand million millionth part, a calculation, a portion,

original: bgrang ba dang / dpe dang rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /
analyzed: bgrang ba dang / dpe dang rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /
translated: a number, a simile, or an example, up to a comparison.

original: bskrun pa tsam gyi bar du yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: bskrun pa tsam gyi bar du yang mi bzod do //
translated: It does not bear comparison.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig las ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig las ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is with one tathāgata,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams snga ma dag na rdul phra rab kyi rdul de dag ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag pas kyang ches mang zhing /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams snga ma dag na rdul phra rab kyi rdul de dag ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag pas kyang ches mang zhing /
translated: so it is with as many perfect buddhas as there are atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions, and even more than that.

original: tshad med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las byang chub sems dpa' skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la chos kyi snang ba dang / gsal ba dang sprin chen po chos kyi dbyings dus gsum gyi mdzod ces bya ba bzod ;
analyzed: tshad med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las byang chub sems dpa' skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la chos kyi snang ba dang / gsal ba dang sprin chen po chos kyi dbyings dus gsum gyi mdzod ces bya ba bzod ;
translated: In an instant, a short moment, a small fraction of time, from the immeasurable tathāgatas, the bodhisattvas receive the illumination of the Dharma, the great cloud of Dharma, the treasury of the dharmadhātu of the three times, called the “patience of the Dharma.”

original: yang dag par len /
analyzed: yang dag par len /
translated: They take it up correctly.

original: bdag gir byed /
analyzed: bdag gir byed /
translated: They make it their own.

original: yang dag par 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin te /
translated: They hold it correctly.

original: de'i phyir na sa 'di ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sa 'di ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this bhūmi is called the Cloud of Dharma.

original: de la chos kyi dbyings dus gsum gyi mdzod ces bya ba la chos kyi dbyings ni brjod pa'i gzhi gsum gyi mdzod do //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings dus gsum gyi mdzod ces bya ba la chos kyi dbyings ni brjod pa'i gzhi gsum gyi mdzod do //
translated: In the treasury of the dharmadhātu of the three times, the dharmadhātu is the treasury of the three bases of expression.

original: sprin dang / 'brug sgra dang / glog la sogs pa dang 'dra bas khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: sprin dang / 'brug sgra dang / glog la sogs pa dang 'dra bas khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood to be like a cloud, the sound of thunder, lightning, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni rang gi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen ba dang / chos kyi snang ba chen po bsgrags ba'i 'brug sgra sgrogs pa mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni rang gi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen ba dang / chos kyi snang ba chen po bsgrags ba'i 'brug sgra sgrogs pa mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: O son of the victors! Furthermore, the bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bhūmi Cloud of Dharma, through the power of his own aspirations, is one who is compassionate, has great compassion, and proclaims the sound of thunder that is the proclamation of the great light of the Dharma.🔽He is one who has the lightning of higher knowledge, awareness, and fearlessness, is greatly shaken by the light of great rays,

original: rig pa dang mi 'jigs pa'i glog 'gyu ba 'od zer chen po'i drung gis shin tu bskyod pa bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi sprin gyi dra ba stugs po chen pos kun du khebs pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mi 'jigs pa'i glog 'gyu ba 'od zer chen po'i drung gis shin tu bskyod pa bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi sprin gyi dra ba stugs po chen pos kun du khebs pa /
translated: is covered by the great thick net of the clouds of merit and wisdom,

original: lus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sprin 'khyil pa kun du ston pa /
analyzed: lus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sprin 'khyil pa kun du ston pa /
translated: and displays the swirling clouds of various bodies.

original: chos kyi sgra chen po sgrogs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi sgra chen po sgrogs pa /
translated: He proclaims the great sound of the Dharma,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos kyi sgra chen po sgrogs pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos kyi sgra chen po sgrogs pa /
translated: and he proclaims the great sound of the Dharma of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: bdud kyi phyogs shin tu tshar gcod pa kun nas bsdus te /
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs shin tu tshar gcod pa kun nas bsdus te /
translated: He completely subdues the forces of Mara.

original: skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams snga ma de dag na rdul phra rab kyi rdul ji snyed yod @255b pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum de dag rgyas par bkang la /
analyzed: skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams snga ma de dag na rdul phra rab kyi rdul ji snyed yod @255b pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum de dag rgyas par bkang la /
translated: In an instant, a short moment, a small fraction of time, he fills as many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of world systems in the ten directions as there are atoms in all the world systems in the east with light.

original: de dag pas kyang ches mang zhing tshad med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig 'bum rgyas par bkang ste /
analyzed: de dag pas kyang ches mang zhing tshad med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig 'bum rgyas par bkang ste /
translated: He fills even more than that, with countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of world systems.

original: dge ba'i bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyi char chen pos bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dge ba'i bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyi char chen pos bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: With a great rain of the nectar of virtue,

original: sems can rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i dus nas mi shes pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang / me lce thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i dus nas mi shes pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang / me lce thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed de /
translated: he completely extinguishes the dust and flames of the afflictions that have arisen from ignorance in the minds of sentient beings since beginningless time.

original: de'i phyir na sa 'di ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la 'od zer chen po rab tu 'byung ba ni rlung lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sa 'di ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la 'od zer chen po rab tu 'byung ba ni rlung lta bu'o //
translated: The great light that shines forth is like the wind.

original: 'khor ba na lus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi klong 'khyil ba kun du ston pa ni klong 'khyil ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba na lus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi klong 'khyil ba kun du ston pa ni klong 'khyil ba lta bu'o //
translated: The display of the coils of various bodies in cyclic existence is like the coils of a snake.

original: chos kyi sgra chen po sgrogs pa zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'i sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sgra chen po sgrogs pa zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'i sgra lta bu'o //
translated: The proclamation of the great sound of Dharma is like the sound of rain.

original: de lta bu sa'i nges pa'i tshig gis 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas mthu bla na med pa dang / bla na yod pas ston te /
analyzed: de lta bu sa'i nges pa'i tshig gis 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas mthu bla na med pa dang / bla na yod pas ston te /
translated: Having thus taught the presentation of this stage by way of its definition, its unsurpassed and surpassed power is taught.

original: de la mthu bla na med pa dang / bla na yod pa nyid ni gnas dang / gzhi dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / bya ba sgrub pa dang / yongs su tshim byed pa dang / rgya che ba nyid dang / rnam pa drug tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mthu bla na med pa dang / bla na yod pa nyid ni gnas dang / gzhi dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / bya ba sgrub pa dang / yongs su tshim byed pa dang / rgya che ba nyid dang / rnam pa drug tu rig par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the unsurpassed and surpassed power should be known as sixfold: in terms of basis, ground, intrinsic nature, accomplishment of action, satisfaction, and vastness.

original: de la mthu de ni sems can gzhan gyi mthu las bltas te bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de la mthu de ni sems can gzhan gyi mthu las bltas te bla na med pa'o //
translated: That power is unsurpassed in comparison to the power of other sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu las bltas te bla na yod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu las bltas te bla na yod pa'o //
translated: It is surpassed by the power of the Tathagatas.

original: de la gnas ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la gnas ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The bases are four:

original: rnam par thar ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / rgya mtsho ltar 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes mngon par sgrub pa dang ldan pa'i gzungs dang / rdzu 'phrul bya ba'i mngon par shes pa ste sngar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / rgya mtsho ltar 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes mngon par sgrub pa dang ldan pa'i gzungs dang / rdzu 'phrul bya ba'i mngon par shes pa ste sngar bstan pa'o //
translated: the inconceivable liberation, the ocean-seal samadhi, the dharani associated with the accomplishment of knowledge, and the superknowledge of the performance of miracles, as previously explained.

original: gzhi ni phyi rol gyi dngos po sa la sogs pa dang / nang gi rang gi lus kyi dngos po ste gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gzhi ni phyi rol gyi dngos po sa la sogs pa dang / nang gi rang gi lus kyi dngos po ste gang gi phyir /
translated: The bases are external things such as earth, etc., and internal things such as one's own body, because

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na yang dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na yang dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Moreover, O Son of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva who is on this Bodhisattva Ground Cloud of Dharma, in one world, starting from the time he is in the Tuṣita palace,

original: 'pho ba dang / gshegs pa dang / lhums na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / bskul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i sa zhes bya ba'i bar du de @256a * //
analyzed: 'pho ba dang / gshegs pa dang / lhums na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / bskul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i sa zhes bya ba'i bar du de @256a * //
translated: conquering Mara, attaining perfect buddhahood, being requested to turn the wheel of the Dharma, and the great parinirvana.

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang / gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang / gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He manifests all the deeds of the Tathagata in accordance with the aspirations and dispositions of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du gnyis nas 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na rdul phra rab kyi rdul de dag ji snyed yod pa de dag pas kyang ches mang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa'i bar dag na yang dga' ldan gyi
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis nas 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na rdul phra rab kyi rdul de dag ji snyed yod pa de dag pas kyang ches mang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa'i bar dag na yang dga' ldan gyi
translated: In the same way, in two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, up to countless hundreds of thousands of kotis of nayutas of world systems, as many as the number of atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya-transcendent world system, he manifests the descent from the Tuṣita heaven, entering the womb, being born, mastering the arts, enjoying sensual pleasures, renouncing, practicing austerities, going to the place of enlightenment, sitting on the seat of enlightenment,🔽conquering Mara, attaining perfect buddhahood, being requested to turn the wheel of the Dharma, and the great parinirvana.

original: pho brang na bzhugs pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i sa zhes bya ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang / gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du byin gyis rlob po zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: pho brang na bzhugs pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i sa zhes bya ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang / gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du byin gyis rlob po zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: From the time of his dwelling in the palace until the time of his great parinirvana, the Tathagata's deeds are all consecrated in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings and in accordance with those to be trained.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the own-character is twofold:

original: lus la sogs pa yongs su bsgyur ba dang sprul pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa yongs su bsgyur ba dang sprul pa'o //
translated: the transformation of the body, etc., and emanation.

original: yongs su bsgyur ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su bsgyur ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The transformation is to be understood as threefold:

original: dog pa dang yangs par yongs su bsgyur ba dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar yongs su bsgyur ba dang / sems can thams cad brgyan pa la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi dbang gis yongs su bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: dog pa dang yangs par yongs su bsgyur ba dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar yongs su bsgyur ba dang / sems can thams cad brgyan pa la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi dbang gis yongs su bsgyur ba ste /
translated: the transformation of the narrow into the vast, the transformation of one thing into another, and the transformation by the power of consecration, such as the adornment of all sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir ye shes kyi dbang de lta bu thob cing shin tu rnam par brtags pa'i ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa de 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas nyon mongs pa can ni yongs su dag pa nyid du byin gyis rlob po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ye shes kyi dbang de lta bu thob cing shin tu rnam par brtags pa'i ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa de 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas nyon mongs pa can ni yongs su dag pa nyid du byin gyis rlob po //
translated: Because he has attained such knowledge, and because he has the knowledge and the superknowledges, he can, if he wishes, transform a defiled world into a pure one.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyid du byin gyis rlob po //🔽'dod na dog pa ni yangs pa nyid du byin gyis rlob po //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyid du byin gyis rlob po // 'dod na dog pa ni yangs pa nyid du byin gyis rlob po //
translated: He can transform a pure world into a defiled one.🔽If he wishes, he can transform a small place into a large one.

original: yangs pa ni dog pa nyid du byin gyis rlob po //
analyzed: yangs pa ni dog pa nyid du byin gyis rlob po //
translated: He can transform a large place into a small one.

original: de bzhin tha gru che ba dang ; rgya chen por gyur ba dang / tshad med pa dang / phra ba dang / rags pa dang / tshol ba dang steng g-yogs med pa dang / gzhi phyal ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang khyu mchog tu gyur pas mngon par sgrub pa de dang der byin gyis rlob po //🔽'dod na rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la /
analyzed: de bzhin tha gru che ba dang ; rgya chen por gyur ba dang / tshad med pa dang / phra ba dang / rags pa dang / tshol ba dang steng g-yogs med pa dang / gzhi phyal ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang khyu mchog tu gyur pas mngon par sgrub pa de dang der byin gyis rlob po // 'dod na rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la /
translated: immeasurable, subtle, coarse, inverted, and uncovered, as well as the worlds of the ground, the sky, and so forth, in a single atom.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams khong yug dang / mtsho dang bcas pa thams cad dang ldan pa gcig byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams khong yug dang / mtsho dang bcas pa thams cad dang ldan pa gcig byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: If he wishes, he manifests in a single atom all the worlds with their oceans and continents.

original: rdul pha rab kyi rdul de yang mi skye la /
analyzed: rdul pha rab kyi rdul de yang mi skye la /
translated: That atom does not increase,

original: bya ba de dag kyang kun du ston to //
analyzed: bya ba de dag kyang kun du ston to //
translated: and those actions are all revealed.

original: rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / @256b lnga nas brjod du med pa'i bar du thams cad kyang khor yug dang / mtsho dang bcas par byin gyis rlob ste rdul phra rab kyi rdul de yang mi skye la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / @256b lnga nas brjod du med pa'i bar du thams cad kyang khor yug dang / mtsho dang bcas par byin gyis rlob ste rdul phra rab kyi rdul de yang mi skye la /
translated: In a single atom, he manifests and blesses two world systems, three, four, five, up to manifesting all of them, with their surrounding mountains and oceans, in a single atom.

original: bya ba de dag kyang kun du ston to //
analyzed: bya ba de dag kyang kun du ston to //
translated: And that atom does not increase, and those actions are all manifested.

original: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi bkod pa kun du ston to //
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi bkod pa kun du ston to //
translated: If he wishes, he manifests the array of two world systems in one world system.

original: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i bar gyi bkod pa kun du ston to //
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i bar gyi bkod pa kun du ston to //
translated: If he wishes, he manifests the array of up to inexpressibly many world systems in one world system.

original: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi bkod pa 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis su kun du ston to //
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi bkod pa 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis su kun du ston to //
translated: If he wishes, he manifests the array of one world system in two world systems.

original: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu yang kun du ston to //
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i bar dag tu yang kun du ston to //
translated: If he wishes, he manifests the array of one world system in up to inexpressibly many world systems.

original: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag na sems can gyi khams ji snyed yod pa de dag 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu bkod de /
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag na sems can gyi khams ji snyed yod pa de dag 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu bkod de /
translated: If he wishes, he can place in one world-realm all the beings that exist in as many world-realms as there are atoms in inexpressibly many buddha-fields.

original: sems can rnams la gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod pa yang med do //
translated: And he does it without harming the beings or the world-realm.

original: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na sems can gyi khams ji snyed yod pa de dag 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag tu 'god de /
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na sems can gyi khams ji snyed yod pa de dag 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag tu 'god de /
translated: If he wishes, he can place in inexpressibly many world-realms all the beings that exist in one world-realm.

original: sems can rnams la gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod pa yang med do //
translated: And he does it without harming the beings or the world-realm.

original: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la 'god de /
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la 'god de /
translated: If he wishes, he can place in one pore of his skin all the beings that exist in inexpressibly many world-realms.

original: sems can rnams la gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod pa yang med do //
translated: And he does it without harming the beings or the world-realms.

original: 'dod na skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul bkod pa gcig kun du ston to //
analyzed: 'dod na skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul bkod pa gcig kun du ston to //
translated: If he wishes, he can display in one pore of his skin the array of all the buddha-fields.

original: 'dod na sangs rgyas thams cad yul bkod pa brjod du med pa'i bar dag kun du ston to zhes bya ba dang / 'og nas 'dod na sems can thams cad la bsam pa bzhin du gzugs kyi lus kyi gnas brgyan par byin gyis rlob po //
analyzed: 'dod na sangs rgyas thams cad yul bkod pa brjod du med pa'i bar dag kun du ston to zhes bya ba dang / 'og nas 'dod na sems can thams cad la bsam pa bzhin du gzugs kyi lus kyi gnas brgyan par byin gyis rlob po //
translated: And later on, if he wishes, he can bless the bodies of all beings to be like the body of the Tathagata.

original: rang gi lus de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi lus de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: And so on as stated in the sutra.

original: bya ba sgrub pa ni mchod pa'i sgo nas byang chub kyi tshogs bsags pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa ni mchod pa'i sgo nas byang chub kyi tshogs bsags pa ste /
translated: Accomplishing activities is the accumulation of the requisites for enlightenment through worship.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag na rdul phra rab kyi rdul ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi lus skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la sprul par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa dag na rdul phra rab kyi rdul ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi lus skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la sprul par byed do //
translated: Because if he wishes, in one instant, in one moment, in one small fraction of time, he can manifest as many bodies as there are atoms in inexpressibly many buddha-fields.

original: lus re re la yang de snyed kyi lag pa kun du ston to //
analyzed: lus re re la yang de snyed kyi lag pa kun du ston to //
translated: And in each body he can manifest that many hands.

original: lag pa de dag gis kyang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: lag pa de dag gis kyang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams la mchod pa byed do //
translated: With those hands they make offerings to the buddhas in the ten directions.

original: lag pa re res kyang me tog gi phur ma gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'thor ro //
analyzed: lag pa re res kyang me tog gi phur ma gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'thor ro //
translated: With each hand they toss flower baskets as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River to those blessed buddhas.

original: me tog la ji lta ba bzhin du spos dang / @257a * //
analyzed: me tog la ji lta ba bzhin du spos dang / @257a * //
translated: Just as with flowers, so it is with incense,

original: phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams dang / bkod pa thams cad kyang de bzhin no //🔽lus re re la yang de snyed kyi mgo byin gyis rlob cing /
analyzed: phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams dang / bkod pa thams cad kyang de bzhin no // lus re re la yang de snyed kyi mgo byin gyis rlob cing /
translated: garlands, ointments, clothing, parasols, banners, and flags, and with all the adornments.🔽For each body they bless that many heads.

original: mgo re re la yang de snyed kyi lce byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: mgo re re la yang de snyed kyi lce byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: For each head they bless that many tongues.

original: lce de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bsngags pa brjod do //
analyzed: lce de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bsngags pa brjod do //
translated: With those tongues they praise those blessed buddhas.

original: sems bskyed pa re re la yang phyogs bcu khyab par 'gro ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa re re la yang phyogs bcu khyab par 'gro ste /
translated: With each production of the mind they pervade the ten directions.

original: sems bskyed pa tsam gyis kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa tshad med pa nas /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa tsam gyis kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa tshad med pa nas /
translated: By merely generating the mind of enlightenment, he blesses the immeasurable complete enlightenment,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bkod pa'i bar du byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bkod pa'i bar du byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: and he blesses the array of the great parinirvāṇa.

original: dus gsum gyi lus tshad med pa yang byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi lus tshad med pa yang byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: He blesses the immeasurable bodies of the three times.

original: rang gi lus la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa tshad med par byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: rang gi lus la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa tshad med par byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He blesses his own body as the immeasurable array of the qualities of the immeasurable buddhafields of the buddhas, the transcendent lords.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa thams cad kyang rang gi lus la byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa thams cad kyang rang gi lus la byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He blesses all the destructions and creations of the world-realms in his own body.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang spu'i khung bu gcig nas 'byin te sems can rnams la yang gnod pa mi byed do //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang spu'i khung bu gcig nas 'byin te sems can rnams la yang gnod pa mi byed do //
translated: He emits all the circles of wind from a single pore without harming any sentient beings.

original: 'dod na rgya mtsho'i mthar thug pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams chu'i phung po gcig tu byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: 'dod na rgya mtsho'i mthar thug pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams chu'i phung po gcig tu byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: If he wishes, he blesses the world-realm that extends to the end of space as a single mass of water.

original: der yang padma chen por byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: der yang padma chen por byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He also manifests a great lotus.

original: padma chen po de'i 'od kyi bkod pas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams mu med pa rgyas par gang bar byed de /
analyzed: padma chen po de'i 'od kyi bkod pas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams mu med pa rgyas par gang bar byed de /
translated: The array of the light of that great lotus fills the endless world systems.

original: de la yang byang chub kyi shing chen po kun du ston pas na /
analyzed: de la yang byang chub kyi shing chen po kun du ston pas na /
translated: He also manifests a great tree of enlightenment.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thabs cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang kun du ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thabs cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang kun du ston to //
translated: He also manifests omniscience, which is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: rang gi lus la phyogs bcu'i nor bu dang / glog dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od byin gyis rlob pa nas /
analyzed: rang gi lus la phyogs bcu'i nor bu dang / glog dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od byin gyis rlob pa nas /
translated: He blesses his own body to be the light of the jewels, lightning, moon, and sun in the ten directions,

original: 'od dang snang ba thams cad kyi bar du byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: 'od dang snang ba thams cad kyi bar du byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: up to and including all light and radiance.

original: kha'i dbugs kyis kyang phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa g-yo bar byed de /
analyzed: kha'i dbugs kyis kyang phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa g-yo bar byed de /
translated: He also blesses his own breath to shake the endless world systems in each direction,

original: sems can rnams 'jigs par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'jigs par yang mi byed do //
translated: without frightening any beings.

original: phyogs bcu'i rlung gis 'jig pa dang / mes 'jig pa dang / chus 'jig par yang byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i rlung gis 'jig pa dang / mes 'jig pa dang / chus 'jig par yang byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He also blesses the winds in the ten directions to be the destruction by wind, fire, and water.

original: 'dod na sems can thams cad la bsam pa bzhin du gzugs kyi lus kyi gnas brgyan par byin gyis rlob bo //🔽rang gi lus de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: 'dod na sems can thams cad la bsam pa bzhin du gzugs kyi lus kyi gnas brgyan par byin gyis rlob bo // rang gi lus de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: If he wishes, he can bless the bodies of all sentient beings with the adornments of the bodies of all Buddhas.🔽He can bless his own body as the body of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rang gi lus su byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rang gi lus su byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He can bless the body of the Tathagata as his own body.

original: de @257b bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: de @257b bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He can bless the body of the Tathagata as his own Buddha-land.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: He can bless his own Buddha-land as the body of the Tathagata.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag dang / gzhan yang bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa dag kun du ston to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag dang / gzhan yang bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa dag kun du ston to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: “ O Child of the Buddha, the Bodhisattva who is on the stage of the Dharma Cloud can manifest these miracles and also countless other miracles, in the hundreds of thousands of millions of billions.”

original: yongs su tshim par byed pa ni the tshom du gyur pa rnams la rang gi mthu kun du bstan pa dang / chos thams cad bshad pa ste gang gi phyir /
analyzed: yongs su tshim par byed pa ni the tshom du gyur pa rnams la rang gi mthu kun du bstan pa dang / chos thams cad bshad pa ste gang gi phyir /
translated: The satisfaction is the display of one's own power to those who have doubts, and the explanation of all the Dharmas.

original: de nas 'khor de'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / dbang phyug chen po dang /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / dbang phyug chen po dang /
translated: Then, some of the Bodhisattvas in that assembly, and some of the gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, demigods, Indras, Brahmas, world guardians, Mahesvara,

original: gnas gtsang ma pa kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma pa kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: and some of the pure abode gods thought this:

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba'i spyod yul yang de ltar tshad med na /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba'i spyod yul yang de ltar tshad med na /
translated: If the Bodhisattvas' domain of magical emanations is like this, immeasurable,🔽what kind of magical emanations do the Tathagatas have?🔽Then, the Bodhisattva Vimuktasena, knowing the thoughts and concepts in the minds of that assembly,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul ci 'dra ba zhig yod snyam pa dang / de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas 'khor de'i sems kyi bsam pa'i rnam par rtog pa shes nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul ci 'dra ba zhig yod snyam pa dang / de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas 'khor de'i sems kyi bsam pa'i rnam par rtog pa shes nas /
translated: said to the Bodhisattva Vajraketu,🔽 You should explain the Tathagata's magical emanations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vajra garbha said to him, “O jinaputra!

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras kye ma 'khor 'di the tshom du gyur na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras kye ma 'khor 'di the tshom du gyur na /
translated: O jinaputra! Since this assembly has doubts,

original: de dag gi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi the tshom gcad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to eliminate their doubts,🔽please manifest a small display of the bodhisattvas’ miraculous powers.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi bkod pa cung zad cig legs par bstan pa mdzod cig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin kun du🔽ston pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi bkod pa cung zad cig legs par bstan pa mdzod cig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi tshogs kyi rang bzhin kun du ston pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vajra garbha at that time entered the bodhisattva samādhi called the display of the nature of the accumulation of all buddha realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi tshogs rang bzhin kun du ston pa la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi tshogs rang bzhin kun du ston pa la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu /
translated: As soon as the bodhisattva Vajra garbha entered the bodhisattva samādhi called the display of the nature of the accumulation of all buddha realms,

original: de nas de nyid kyi tshe byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang /
analyzed: de nas de nyid kyi tshe byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang /
translated: At that time, the entire retinue of bodhisattvas, as well as the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, Śakra, Brahmā, the world guardians,

original: dbang phyug chen po dang / gnas gtsang ma pa'i 'khor thams cad @258a * //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po dang / gnas gtsang ma pa'i 'khor thams cad @258a * //
translated: Maheśvara, and the entire retinue of the pure abodes,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po'i lus kyi khor na 'khod par rang rang gis shes par gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po'i lus kyi khor na 'khod par rang rang gis shes par gyur te /
translated: all perceived themselves to be seated within the body of the bodhisattva Vajra garbha.

original: der sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon du grub par shes so //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon du grub par shes so //
translated: They understood that the buddha realm had been actualized there.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na rnam pa dang / bkod pa gang dag yod pa de dag kyang bskal pa bye ba tshang bas kyang brjod par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na rnam pa dang / bkod pa gang dag yod pa de dag kyang bskal pa bye ba tshang bas kyang brjod par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The aspects and arrays that existed in that buddha realm could not be easily described even in a hundred million eons.

original: der byang chub kyi shing stong gsum 'du ma phrag bcur khyab pa'i sdong po can /
analyzed: der byang chub kyi shing stong gsum 'du ma phrag bcur khyab pa'i sdong po can /
translated: There, the tree of awakening had a trunk that extended throughout a hundred million trichiliocosms.

original: stong gsum bye ba yongs su tshang ba tsam du shin tu rgyas pa tshad med pa'i yal ga can /
analyzed: stong gsum bye ba yongs su tshang ba tsam du shin tu rgyas pa tshad med pa'i yal ga can /
translated: It was so vast and immeasurable that it filled a hundred billion worlds.

original: rtse mo shin tu mtho ba byung ste /
analyzed: rtse mo shin tu mtho ba byung ste /
translated: Its peak was extremely high.

original: de dang rkyen du 'bab par byang chub kyi snying po de la seng ge'i khri rgya chen po byung nas /
analyzed: de dang rkyen du 'bab par byang chub kyi snying po de la seng ge'i khri rgya chen po byung nas /
translated: In accord with the conditions, a vast lion throne appeared in the center of the Bodhimaṇḍa.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par shes pa'i blo gros thams cad kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba byang chub kyi snying po dam par gshegs te bzhugs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par shes pa'i blo gros thams cad kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba byang chub kyi snying po dam par gshegs te bzhugs par mthong ngo //
translated: The Tathāgata named Sarvabhijñāmatināṭarāja went to the sublime Bodhimaṇḍa and sat upon it.

original: de ltar de na bkod pa ji snyed par gyur pa de dag ni bskal pa bye ba tshang bas kyang brjod par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de na bkod pa ji snyed par gyur pa de dag ni bskal pa bye ba tshang bas kyang brjod par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The array of that place was such that it could not be described even in a hundred billion eons.

original: de la cho 'phrul chen po de bstan nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang /
analyzed: de la cho 'phrul chen po de bstan nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang /
translated: the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, Śakra, Brahmā,

original: 'jig rten skyong ba dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / gnas gtsang ma'i 'khor thams cad na gnas pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'khod pa dang / de nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de ngo mtshar dang rmad du gyur nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / gnas gtsang ma'i 'khor thams cad na gnas pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'khod pa dang / de nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de ngo mtshar dang rmad du gyur nas /
translated: the world guardians, Maheśvara, and all those dwelling in the pure abodes were seated just as they were. Then the entire retinue, filled with wonder and amazement,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po de nyid la nges par sems shing 'khod par gyur to zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po de nyid la nges par sems shing 'khod par gyur to zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: remained contemplating the bodhisattva Vajra garbha.

original: de ltar the tshom du gyur pa rnams la ;
analyzed: de ltar the tshom du gyur pa rnams la ;
translated: Thus, for those who became doubtful,

original: rang gi mthu kun du bstan pas yongs su tshim par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi mthu kun du bstan pas yongs su tshim par byed pa bstan to //
translated: it was taught that he satisfied them by displaying his full power.

original: chos thams cad bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that all dharmas are taught?

translated: Then the bodhisattva Vimukti candra said:🔽

original: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba yin na /
analyzed: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba yin na /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ming ci zhes bya /

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying bos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying bos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras ting nge 'dzin 'di'i spyod yul dang / yul gyi bkod pa ji lta bu /
translated: “O son of the victors, what is the domain and the array of the domain of this samādhi?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said:🔽“O son of the victors, listen and I will tell you about the domain and the array of the domain of this samādhi.”

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la shin tu bsgom pa ni 'dod na sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di 'dra ba 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dam /🔽de bas kyang mang du rang gi lus las kun du ston to //

translated: O son of the victors, the bodhisattva who has cultivated this concentration well can, if he wishes, display in his own body as many buddha realms as there are atoms in buddha realms as numerous as the atoms in a hundred thousand quintillion world systems, or even more than that.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dra ba 'bum phrag mang po 'thob ste /

translated: O son of the victors, the bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva bhūmi Cloud of Dharma obtains many hundreds of thousands of such concentrations.🔽Therefore, the body

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus sam /🔽lus kyi las ni byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tsha ba thob pa /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can la gnas pa dag gis kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus sam / lus kyi las ni byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tsha ba thob pa / byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can la gnas pa dag gis kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: or physical actions of that bodhisattva,

original: ngag gam ngag gi las kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ngag gam ngag gi las kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: or even the speech or verbal actions of that bodhisattva, are not easily understood even by bodhisattvas who have attained the forbearance of nonarising dharmas and are on the bodhisattva bhūmi Excellent Wisdom.

original: yid dam yid kyi las kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dam yid kyi las kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The mental activity of the mind is also not easy to know.

original: rdzu 'phrul yang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul yang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: Miraculous powers are also not easy to know.

original: dus gsum la rnam par lta ba yang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum la rnam par lta ba yang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The view of the three times is also not easy to know.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul la 'jug pa yang shes par sla ba ma yin no //

original: ye shes kyi yul yang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul yang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The domain of wisdom is also not easy to know.

analyzed: rnam par thar pas rnam par rtse ba yang shes par sla ba ma yin no // sprul pa'i las sam / byin gyi rlabs kyi las sam /
translated: The play of liberation is also not easy to know.🔽The activity of emanation,🔽the activity of blessing,

original: mthu'i las kyang @259a * //🔽shes par sla ba ma yin pa nas mdor bsdu na gom pa 'jog cing 'degs pa'i las kyi bar du yang byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab thob pa /
analyzed: mthu'i las kyang @259a * // shes par sla ba ma yin pa nas mdor bsdu na gom pa 'jog cing 'degs pa'i las kyi bar du yang byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab thob pa /
translated: or the activity of power🔽are not easy to know. In brief, even the activity of placing and lifting the feet is not easy to know for the Bodhisattvas who have attained the position of regent,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can la gnas pa dag gis kyang shes par sla ba ma yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can la gnas pa dag gis kyang shes par sla ba ma yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: those who abide on the Bodhisattva ground of Excellent Wisdom.

original: grangs rgya che ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: grangs rgya che ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The vast number is taught in the following.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di ni mdor bsdus te bstan na yang de ltar tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di ni mdor bsdus te bstan na yang de ltar tshad med pa ste /
translated: O son of the victors, this bodhisattva bhūmi Cloud of Dharma, even when taught concisely, is thus immeasurable.

original: rgya cher ni bskal pa grangs med pa 'bum phrag du mas bstan kyang mthar thug par mi 'gyur bar shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni bskal pa grangs med pa 'bum phrag du mas bstan kyang mthar thug par mi 'gyur bar shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: If taught extensively, it should be understood that it would not be concluded even in a hundred thousand eons.

original: da ni grangs rgya che ba de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa mtha' dag bstan par mi nus pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni grangs rgya che ba de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa mtha' dag bstan par mi nus pa ston te /
translated: Now, in order to teach that very vast number, and in order to teach that the end of the bhūmi of the tathāgatas cannot be shown,

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
translated: it is said that the bodhisattva Vimukti candra said,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa'i yul gyi byin gyis brlabs pa 'di yang de ltar tshad med na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul dang / yul la 'jug pa ci 'dra /

translated: O son of the victors, if the blessings of the domain of conduct of the bodhisattvas is thus immeasurable, what is the domain and the engagement in the domain of the tathāgatas like?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha declared,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /

original: dper na mi la la zhig gis gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas rde'u rgya shug gi tshi gu tsam gnyis sam gsum zhig blangs te /🔽'di skad du 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag na sa'i khams ji snyed cig yod /
analyzed: dper na mi la la zhig gis gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas rde'u rgya shug gi tshi gu tsam gnyis sam gsum zhig blangs te / 'di skad du 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag na sa'i khams ji snyed cig yod /
translated: Suppose someone were to take two or three pebbles the size of juniper berries from the four continents of this world system and say,🔽‘Compared to the limitless world systems, how much greater is the extent of the earth element that exists in them?

original: rde'u 'di las ji tsam zhig gi lhag par 'phags shing lhag par tshad med ces zer ba zhig yod na /
analyzed: rde'u 'di las ji tsam zhig gi lhag par 'phags shing lhag par tshad med ces zer ba zhig yod na /
translated: How much more is there than in these pebbles?’

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ye shes tshad med pa mnga' ba rnams kyi chos nyid la /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar khyod de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ye shes tshad med pa mnga' ba rnams kyi chos nyid la /
translated: “O son of the victorious ones, in the same way, when you compare the reality of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the completely perfect buddhas who possess immeasurable wisdom,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid kyis 'jal ba ni khyod kyi tshig 'di de dang 'dra bar bdag gis dbags so //
translated: with the reality of the bodhisattvas, I understand that your words are similar to that example.”

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas gang blangs pa'i sa'i khams ni chung la /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras ji ltar gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas gang blangs pa'i sa'i khams ni chung la /
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, just as the earth element taken from the world systems of the four continents is small,

original: lhag ma las pa ni tshad med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: lhag ma las pa ni tshad med pa de bzhin du /
translated: while the remainder is immeasurable,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di kho na yang bskal pa dpag tu med par bstan kyang phyogs tsam zhig bstan du zad na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di kho na yang bskal pa dpag tu med par bstan kyang phyogs tsam zhig bstan du zad na /
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, even if the bodhisattva ground Cloud of Dharma were to be explained for countless eons, it would only be a partial explanation,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa lta smos @259b kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa lta smos @259b kyang ci dgos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of the ground of the tathagatas?

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras khyod mos par bya'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras khyod mos par bya'o //
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, you should have conviction in this!

original: khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: You should understand this!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di bdag gi mdun na dpang du bzhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di bdag gi mdun na dpang du bzhugs te /
translated: The tathagatas are present before me as witnesses.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras gal te phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mu med pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed cig /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras gal te phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mu med pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed cig /
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, if the buddha realms of the ten directions, as many as the limitless particles of the world systems,

original: sa 'di lta bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa 'di lta bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: were filled by bodhisattvas who have attained this ground,

original: dper na bu ram shing gi tshal lam /🔽'od ma'i tshal lam /🔽'dam bu'i tshal lam /
analyzed: dper na bu ram shing gi tshal lam / 'od ma'i tshal lam / 'dam bu'i tshal lam /
translated: or as the bamboo in a bamboo grove,🔽or as the reeds in a reed bed,

original: til gyi tshal bzhin du yongs su gang bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: til gyi tshal bzhin du yongs su gang bar gyur kyang /
translated: or as the sesame seeds in a sesame field.

original: de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrub par bskal pa dpag tu med pa mngon par bsgrubs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes skad cig gcig la byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrub par bskal pa dpag tu med pa mngon par bsgrubs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes skad cig gcig la byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: But even that number of eons would not approach even a hundredth part of the eons of practice of the bodhisattvas’ activities that are accomplished in a single instant of the wisdom of the tathāgatas, which is the domain of the tathāgatas.

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang /
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang /
translated: It would not approach even a thousandth part, a hundred thousandth part, a ten millionth part, a billionth part, a ten billionth part, a trillionth part, a quintillionth part, a count, a fraction,

analyzed: bgrang ba dang / dpe dang rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /🔽bskrun pa tsam gyi bar du nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: a comparison, or an illustration, up to being just a mere fraction of a domain of the tathāgatas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / gsung dang thugs gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyang mi gtong la /
