translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, in this way, the bodhisattvas who possess such wisdom do not abandon the power of the bodhisattva's samadhi, which is nondual with the body, speech, and mind of the tathagatas.

original: sangs rgyas la lta ba dang / mchod pa dang / rim gro yang rab tu byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la lta ba dang / mchod pa dang / rim gro yang rab tu byed de /
translated: They also engage in the practice of seeing the buddhas, making offerings, and serving them.

original: bskal pa re re la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa dag la rnam pa thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i mchod pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i mchod pa dag gis mchod par byed do //
analyzed: bskal pa re re la yang de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa dag la rnam pa thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i mchod pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i mchod pa dag gis mchod par byed do //
translated: In each kalpa, they make offerings to limitless tathagatas with offerings that are vast and endowed with all aspects.🔽They also take up the waves and appearances of those Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi byi gnyi rlabs dang / snang ba yang yang dag par len to zhes bya ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi byi gnyi rlabs dang / snang ba yang yang dag par len to zhes bya ba dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, it is like this:

original: dper na lha'i rgyan chen po'i rnam pa mkhan bzos ma byas pa /
analyzed: dper na lha'i rgyan chen po'i rnam pa mkhan bzos ma byas pa /
translated: For example, a great divine ornament that is not made by a craftsman

original: rin po che chen pos spras pa /
analyzed: rin po che chen pos spras pa /
translated: It is adorned with great jewels.

original: lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur gyi yan lag gi dam pa mgo'am mgul du btags na de ma yin pa'i lha dang mi'i rgyan lhab lhub kyi rnam pa dag gis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi rgyu ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur gyi yan lag gi dam pa mgo'am mgul du btags na de ma yin pa'i lha dang mi'i rgyan lhab lhub kyi rnam pa dag gis mi 'phrogs pa yin no // kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin 'di thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi rgyu ba de dag kyang /
translated: If the king of the gods Vaśavartin were to tie it to his head or his neck, no other ornaments of gods or humans could surpass it.

original: sems can @260a * //
analyzed: sems can @260a * //
translated: “O son of the victors, in the same way, the activity of the wisdom of the bodhisattva who has attained this bodhisattva bhūmi Cloud of Dharma cannot be surpassed by the activity of the wisdom of all sentient beings,🔽all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: thams cad dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu pa thob pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu pa thob pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin te /
translated: and all bodhisattvas from the first bhūmi up to the ninth bhūmi.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes snang ba ni sems can rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar la 'dzud par 'gyur bas de ma yin pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba dag gis mi 'phrogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes snang ba ni sems can rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar la 'dzud par 'gyur bas de ma yin pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba dag gis mi 'phrogs so //
translated: The light of the wisdom of the bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bhūmi, because it causes all sentient beings to enter into the wisdom of omniscience, cannot be overcome by the light of the wisdom of any other sentient being.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: “O jinaputras! In this way,

original: dper na lha'i rgyal po dbang phyug chen po'i 'od ni skye ba'i gnas thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na lha'i rgyal po dbang phyug chen po'i 'od ni skye ba'i gnas thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin te /
translated: for example, the light of Maheśvara, king of the devas, surpasses all other abodes of sentient beings,

original: sems can rnams kyi lus kyang tshim par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus kyang tshim par byed do //
translated: and it satisfies the bodies of sentient beings.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi snang ba yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i sa dug pa thob pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi snang ba yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i sa dug pa thob pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin te /
translated: O son of the victors, in the same way, the light of the wisdom of the bodhisattva who is on this tenth bodhisattva stage, Cloud of Dharma, cannot be overcome by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and by the bodhisattvas who are on the first stage up to the bodhisattvas who are on the ninth stage.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang sems can rnams rab tu 'jog go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang sems can rnams rab tu 'jog go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He also establishes sentient beings in omniscience.”

original: bgrod pa gsum shes pa la sogs pa yang dag par sgrogs pas ni lam gsum yang dag par sgrogs te /
analyzed: bgrod pa gsum shes pa la sogs pa yang dag par sgrogs pas ni lam gsum yang dag par sgrogs te /
translated: By proclaiming the knowledge of the three vehicles and so on, he proclaims the three vehicles.

original: lam gsum la the tshom bcad pa'i lam ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: lam gsum la the tshom bcad pa'i lam ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The path that cuts through doubt about the three vehicles is the path of the three vehicles.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bgrod pa gsum shes pa yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bgrod pa gsum shes pa yang dag par ston to //
translated: O son of the victors, the buddhas, the blessed ones, reveal to the bodhisattvas who possess such wisdom the three kinds of thorough knowledge.

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They teach the thorough knowledge of the differentiation of the realm of phenomena.

original: bgrod pa gsum zhes bya ba ni lam gsum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bgrod pa gsum zhes bya ba ni lam gsum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The three kinds of thorough knowledge are the three paths.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba sgrogs pas mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid kyi lam ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba sgrogs pas mngon par shes pa myur ba nyid kyi lam ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The path of swift superknowledge is so called because it is the path by which one proclaims the secrets of the tathagatas.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is the path that fills all world systems.

original: byin gyi rlabs mtshungs pa nyid kyi las ni byin gyi rlabs mtshungs pa nyid rnam pa gsum du reg par bya ste /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs mtshungs pa nyid kyi las ni byin gyi rlabs mtshungs pa nyid rnam pa gsum du reg par bya ste /
translated: The path of consecration is the path of consecration that is to be touched in three ways.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The consecration of the purification of the realm is the consecration of the purification of the realm.

original: chos ston @260b par snang ba'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyis rlabs dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs te /
analyzed: chos ston @260b par snang ba'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyis rlabs dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs te /
translated: the blessing of the sameness of the appearance of teaching the Dharma, and the blessing of the sameness of manifest complete enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sems can dang / zhing dang / chos thams cad yongs su shes pa'i shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sems can dang / zhing dang / chos thams cad yongs su shes pa'i shes pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang /
translated: Because of that, he teaches the blessing of the illumination of all world-realms, the knowledge of the understanding of all sentient beings, fields, and phenomena, the knowledge of the engagement of the mental activity of all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad kyi yongs su smin pa'i dus ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / 'dul ba las mi g-yo ba dang / chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba shes pa la mkhas pa dang / mdor na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i bar dag yang dag par ston to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yongs su smin pa'i dus ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / 'dul ba las mi g-yo ba dang / chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba shes pa la mkhas pa dang / mdor na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i bar dag yang dag par ston to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the ripening of all sentient beings just as it is, the non-wavering from taming, the skill in the knowledge of the analysis of the differentiation of all phenomena, and in brief, he teaches up to the attainment of the knowledge of omniscience.

original: de ltar mthu bla na yod pas sa 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas sa'i dpe ston to //
analyzed: de ltar mthu bla na yod pas sa 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas sa'i dpe ston to //
translated: Thus, since its power is surpassed, the text has explained the presentation of this stage and now it teaches the example of the stage.

original: de la sa'i dpe ni mtsho dang / ri dang / rgya mtsho dang / nor bu bee d'uryas yon tan rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sa'i dpe ni mtsho dang / ri dang / rgya mtsho dang / nor bu bee d'uryas yon tan rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: The example of the stage should be understood as having four qualities, like an ocean, a mountain, an ocean, and a precious gem.

original: yon tan rnam pa bzhi ni sgrub pa'i yon tan dang / mchog gi yon tan dang / nges par 'byung dka' ba'i nges par 'byung bar 'bras bu che ba nyid kyi yon tan dang / mthar thug par yongs su bsngo ba'i yon tan no //🔽de la sgrub pa'i yon tan ni smon lam la brten nas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel te byang chub thob par byed pas /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bzhi ni sgrub pa'i yon tan dang / mchog gi yon tan dang / nges par 'byung dka' ba'i nges par 'byung bar 'bras bu che ba nyid kyi yon tan dang / mthar thug par yongs su bsngo ba'i yon tan no // de la sgrub pa'i yon tan ni smon lam la brten nas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel te byang chub thob par byed pas /
translated: The four qualities are the quality of accomplishment, the quality of supremacy, the quality of the great fruit of the difficult renunciation of renunciation, and the quality of the dedication of the ultimate.🔽The quality of accomplishment should be understood as the accomplishment of one's own aim and the accomplishment of others' aims.🔽The accomplishment of one's own aim is the increase of one's own roots of virtue, which leads to the attainment of enlightenment.

original: rang gi don sgrub par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi don sgrub par rig par bya ste /
translated: The accomplishment of others' aims is the accomplishment of others' aims through the four means of gathering disciples, based on one's aspirations.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag ni /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, those ten bodhisattva stages

original: rim gyis mngon du phyogs pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi song ba rjes su song bar blta'o //
analyzed: rim gyis mngon du phyogs pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi song ba rjes su song bar blta'o //
translated: One should see that it gradually approaches, and that it is directed toward the omniscient wisdom of all aspects.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, it is like this:

original: dper na mtsho chen po ma dros pa las byung ba'i 'bab chu ni /
analyzed: dper na mtsho chen po ma dros pa las byung ba'i 'bab chu ni /
translated: The water that comes from the great lake Anavatapta

original: klung gi rgyun gyi sgo bzhis 'dzam bu'i gling kun du ngoms par byas kyang mi zad la rnam par 'phel te /
analyzed: klung gi rgyun gyi sgo bzhis 'dzam bu'i gling kun du ngoms par byas kyang mi zad la rnam par 'phel te /
translated: is the source of the four great rivers that satisfy the entire continent of Jambudvīpa, and yet it is inexhaustible and increases.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag la phan par gyur cing /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag la phan par gyur cing /
translated: It benefits countless sentient beings

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i bar du zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i bar du zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: and flows into the great ocean.

original: chu de ni thog ma nyid nas rgya mtsho chen po la mngon du phyogs pa yin no //
analyzed: chu de ni thog ma nyid nas rgya mtsho chen po la mngon du phyogs pa yin no //
translated: From the very beginning, that water is directed toward the great ocean.

original: @261a * // kye rgyal ba'i sras de de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kyi mtsho chen po las byung pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'bab chu yang /
analyzed: @261a * // kye rgyal ba'i sras de de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kyi mtsho chen po las byung pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'bab chu yang /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, the water of the roots of virtue that comes from the great lake of the mind of awakening

original: smon lam chen po'i rgyun gyi sgo bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can gyi khams kun du ngoms par byas kyang mi zad la rnam par 'phel te /
analyzed: smon lam chen po'i rgyun gyi sgo bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can gyi khams kun du ngoms par byas kyang mi zad la rnam par 'phel te /
translated: The stream of great prayers, the four means of gathering disciples, satisfies the whole realm of sentient beings without being exhausted and increases.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag la phan par gyur cing /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag la phan par gyur cing /
translated: It benefits immeasurable sentient beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar gyi rgya mtsho chen po la zhen par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar gyi rgya mtsho chen po la zhen par byed de /
translated: It causes them to enter the great ocean of omniscient exalted wisdom endowed with all aspects.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chu de ni thog ma nas kyang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chu de ni thog ma nas kyang /
translated: That water of the roots of virtue is from the beginning

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgya mtsho chen po la mngon du phyogs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgya mtsho chen po la mngon du phyogs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: directed toward the great ocean of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs yin pas mchog nyid kyi yon tan ni gang gi phyir /🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs yin pas mchog nyid kyi yon tan ni gang gi phyir / kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu po de dag ni /
translated: Since this is the section on omniscience, the qualities of supremacy are explained.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la brten nas yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la brten nas yod par 'gyur te /
translated: O son of the victors, those ten bodhisattva stages exist in dependence on the exalted wisdom of the buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: O son of the victors, it is like this.

original: dper na sa chen po la brten nas /
analyzed: dper na sa chen po la brten nas /
translated: For example, in dependence on the great earth🔽there are ten great kings of mountains.

original: ri'i rgyal po chen po bcu yod par gyur pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po chen po bcu yod par gyur pa 'di lta ste /
translated: They are the great kings of mountains Great,🔽Fragrant, Arouser of Fragrances,🔽Well-Arrayed,🔽Sage Mountain,🔽Forehead-Holder,🔽Horse-Ear,🔽Holder of the Encircling Range,

original: ri'i rgyal po chen po gang ri dang / spos ngad ldang dang / rnam par 'dal dang / drang srong ri dang / gnya' shing 'dzin dang / rta rna ri dang / mu khyud 'dzin dang / khor yug dang / tog can dang / ri'i rgyal po chen po ri rab bo //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po chen po gang ri dang / spos ngad ldang dang / rnam par 'dal dang / drang srong ri dang / gnya' shing 'dzin dang / rta rna ri dang / mu khyud 'dzin dang / khor yug dang / tog can dang / ri'i rgyal po chen po ri rab bo //
translated: and the great king of mountains, Mount Meru.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, it is like this:

original: dper na ri'i rgyal po chen po gangs ri ni /
analyzed: dper na ri'i rgyal po chen po gangs ri ni /
translated: For example, the great king of mountains, the snow mountain,

original: sman gyi rnam pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: sman gyi rnam pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: is the source of all kinds of medicine.

original: sman gyi rnam pa thams cad blang bas thug par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sman gyi rnam pa thams cad blang bas thug par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: It is not exhausted by the taking of all kinds of medicine.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, the bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva level of The Joyful One

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyan dngags dang / bstan bcos dang / gsang sngags dang / rig pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyan dngags dang / bstan bcos dang / gsang sngags dang / rig pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: It is the source of all mundane poetry, treatises, secret spells, and knowledge.

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyan dngags dang / bstan bcos dang / gsang sngags dang / rig pa thams cad 'don pas thug par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyan dngags dang / bstan bcos dang / gsang sngags dang / rig pa thams cad 'don pas thug par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: It is not possible to exhaust the mundane poetry, treatises, secret spells, and knowledge by reciting them.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: “O son of the victors, it is like this:

original: dper na ri'i rgyal po chen po spos kyi ngad ldang ni /
analyzed: dper na ri'i rgyal po chen po spos kyi ngad ldang ni /
translated: The great king of mountains, Gandhamadana,

original: spos kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: spos kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: is the source of all kinds of incense.

original: spos @261b kyi rnam pa thams cad blang bas thug par 'gyur ba med do //🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang /
analyzed: spos @261b kyi rnam pa thams cad blang bas thug par 'gyur ba med do // kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang /
translated: It is not possible to exhaust all the kinds of incense by taking them.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang / sdom pa dang / spyod pa thams cad kyi spos kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang / sdom pa dang / spyod pa thams cad kyi spos kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: “O son of the victors, in the same way, the bodhisattva who is on the Stainless bodhisattva bhūmi is the source of all the bodhisattva’s morality, vows, and conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims dang / sdom pa dang / spyod pa thams cad kyi spos kyis thug par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims dang / sdom pa dang / spyod pa thams cad kyi spos kyis thug par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ morality, vows, and conduct are like incense that never fades.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “O son of the victors, it is like this:

original: ri'i rgyal po chen po rnam par 'dal ni dngos rin po che 'ba' zhig yin zhing /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po chen po rnam par 'dal ni dngos rin po che 'ba' zhig yin zhing /
translated: The great king of mountains, Sumeru, is made of precious substances alone

original: rin po che'i rnam pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: rin po che'i rnam pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: and is the source of all precious substances.

original: rin po che'i rnam pa thams cad blang bas thug par 'gyur ba med do //🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang /
analyzed: rin po che'i rnam pa thams cad blang bas thug par 'gyur ba med do // kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang /
translated: But it is never depleted by the removal of all precious substances.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: “O son of the victors, in the same way, the bodhisattva who is on the Shining bodhisattva bhūmi is the source of all mundane concentrations, superknowledges, liberations, samādhis, and absorptions.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad yongs su dris pa bstan pa rnams kyis thug par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad yongs su dris pa bstan pa rnams kyis thug par 'gyur ba med do //

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: O Son of the Victor, in the same way, the bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva stage Cloud of Dharma is the source of the powers, fearlessnesses, and unshared qualities of the Tathagata.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las yang dag par bstan pa yongs su dris pa bstan pa rnams kyis thug par 'gyur ba med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las yang dag par bstan pa yongs su dris pa bstan pa rnams kyis thug par 'gyur ba med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the questions and answers that demonstrate the activities of the Buddha are inexhaustible.

original: rin po che 'ba' zhig gi ri'i dpe smos pa ni sa brgyad pa dag 'dod chags dang bral ba dag pa'i sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che 'ba' zhig gi ri'i dpe smos pa ni sa brgyad pa dag 'dod chags dang bral ba dag pa'i sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example of the mountain of jewels is mentioned because the eighth stage is the pure stage of freedom from attachment.

original: ri de dag ni sems can ma yin par brjod pa'i dngos po dang / sems can du brjod pa'i 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: ri de dag ni sems can ma yin par brjod pa'i dngos po dang / sems can du brjod pa'i 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: Those mountains are the source of things that are said to be non-sentient beings and of sentient beings.

original: sems can ma yin par brjod pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems can ma yin par brjod pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Things that are said to be non-sentient beings are also of two kinds.

original: yongs su spyad pa'i dngos po dang / rin po che zhes brjod pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: yongs su spyad pa'i dngos po dang / rin po che zhes brjod pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The things to be used and the things to be held, which are called jewels.

original: yongs su spyad pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su spyad pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The things to be used are also of two kinds:

original: 'byung ba mi mnyam pa'i gnyen po'i dngos po dang / 'byung ba mnyam pa ston pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba mi mnyam pa'i gnyen po'i dngos po dang / 'byung ba mnyam pa ston pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: the things to be used as antidotes to the inequalities of the elements, and the things to be used to demonstrate the equality of the elements.

original: dris rab tu phye ba dang / ri drug pa'i 'bras bu'i rnam pa'i ros rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: dris rab tu phye ba dang / ri drug pa'i 'bras bu'i rnam pa'i ros rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The things to be used as antidotes to the inequalities of the elements are the seven jewels of the universal monarch, and the eight royal treasures.

original: sems can du brjod pa ni gnod pa rnam pa drug gi gnyen por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can du brjod pa ni gnod pa rnam pa drug gi gnyen por rig par bya ste /
translated: The things to be used to demonstrate the equality of the elements are the seven riches of the noble ones, and the eight liberations.🔽The things to be held are of two kinds:🔽the things to be held for one’s own use, and the things to be held for the use of others.🔽The things to be held for one’s own use are the three Dharma robes of the monk, and the begging bowl.🔽The things to be held for the use of others are the medicine and the furniture.🔽The things to be used are of two kinds:🔽the things to be used for one’s own benefit, and the things to be used for the benefit of others.

original: gnod pa rnam pa drug ni dbul ba'i gnod pa dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa yams kyi nad kyi gnod pa @263a * //
analyzed: gnod pa rnam pa drug ni dbul ba'i gnod pa dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa yams kyi nad kyi gnod pa @263a * //
translated: The things to be used for one’s own benefit are the four supports of the holy life, and the four kinds of right effort.🔽The things to be used for the benefit of others are the four means of gathering disciples, and the four immeasurables.🔽The things to be used as antidotes to the inequalities of the elements are the seven jewels of the universal monarch, and the eight royal treasures.🔽The seven jewels of the universal monarch are the jewel of the wheel, the jewel of the elephant, the jewel of the horse, the jewel of the queen, the jewel of the gem, the jewel of the householder, and the jewel of the counselor.🔽The eight royal treasures are the treasure of the wheel, the treasure of the elephant, the treasure of the horse, the treasure of the jewel, the treasure of the woman, the treasure of the householder, the treasure of the counselor, and the treasure of the general.🔽The things to be used to demonstrate the equality of the elements are the seven riches of the noble ones, and the eight liberations.🔽The seven riches of the noble ones are faith, morality, shame, embarrassment, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

original: dang ; mu ge'i gnod pa dang / 'dul ba ma yin pa'i gnod pa dang / dbyig dug la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang / phyir rgol ba'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; mu ge'i gnod pa dang / 'dul ba ma yin pa'i gnod pa dang / dbyig dug la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang / phyir rgol ba'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The eight liberations are the liberation of the form realm, the liberation of the formless realm, the liberation of the desire realm, the liberation of

original: de la mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa ni sbyin pa'i gnas yin pas dbul ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa ni sbyin pa'i gnas yin pas dbul ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Since those who possess the five superknowledges are worthy of gifts, they are the antidote to poverty.

analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don gyis thug par 'gyur ba med par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag gis kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyis smos la /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis kyang rab tu phye ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: and the state of universal omniscience is to be known as the one that is fully developed.

analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na rin po che'i ri de dag gis kyang rgya mtsho chen po smos la /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bdag cag kyang dpang du gyur pa sha stags sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor 'dir phyin te /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir bdag cag ji ltar phyin pa de bzhin du /

analyzed: de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas de snyed kyi zhal mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de snyed cig bskyod pa dang / de snyed dag tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: They engage in meditative absorption in those, they see the faces of that many buddhas, they correctly understand the blessings of those buddhas, they shake that many world systems, they go to that many places, and so on.

original: 'phags pas bcu pa las sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs te sa bcu rnams par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pas bcu pa las sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs te sa bcu rnams par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the tenth ground, Cloud of Dharma, from the noble Sutra of the Ten Grounds is complete. The explanation of the ten grounds is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po manydzu shr'i garbha dang / pradzny'a warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sde dang / bande dpal brtsegs kyis bsgyur te zhus nas gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po manydzu shr'i garbha dang / pradzny'a warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sde dang / bande dpal brtsegs kyis bsgyur te zhus nas gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Indian preceptors Mañjuśrīgarbha and Prajñāvarman and the great editor-translator Bandé Yeshé Dé and Bandé Pal-tsek translated and edited this text.
